SHO Hazratganj, Dheerendra Kushwaha, said, “We laid a trap on Lucknow-Kanpur Road. Around 12.30 am, accused Jitendra was tracked riding a bike with a Rae Bareli registration number near a check-point. When he was told to show registration papers, Jitendra opened fire. Then he pressed on the gas and veered towards Jail Road.

Another police team led by station house officer, Alambagh, Anand Shahi intercepted Jitendra and ordered him to surrender, but he again whipped out his gun and opened fire. The cop shot him in the leg and Jitendra fell off the bike. Police said his relative in Charbagh told police that Jitendra wanted money before fleeing to Nepal.

Title: Bihar: 50,000 throng flower exhibition
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Visitors at a two-day flower exhibition at Gyan Bhawan in Patna on Saturday.

PATNA: More than 15,000 plants of different varieties were sold at the two-day flower exhibition-cum-competition, which concluded at Gyan Bhawan on Saturday. Several rare and exotic plants were also displayed at the event organised by the state agriculture department.

As many as 140 florists , who took part in the competition, were felicitated on the occasion. Pavan Kumar Sarraf from Bhagalpur received the first prize.

Speaking at the event, agriculture department secretary N Saravana Kumar said, “The purpose of organizing this exhibition was to promote commercial production of flowers in the state. There is a huge gap between the production and consumption of flowers here.”

Meanwhile, florists claimed that visitors mostly bought hibiscuses and roses from them. Shambhu Kumar Chaurasia, the owner of a nursery in Vaishali , told this newspaper, “Earlier, nature lovers planted flowers and trees. Now, they have become a necessity.”

Several stalls at the exhibition also displayed floral pots. Indrajeet Kumar, a nursery owner from Patna, said, “I have colourful, brown, hanging and double-hanging pots. A lot of people purchased the colourful ones.”

Over 50,000 people reportedly thronged the two-day exhibition. Astha Shrivastava, who bought shrubs and exotic plants, said, “The exhibition has a huge range of plants. More such events should be organised.”

Title: Bihar: ‘RJD to field 27% EBCs and 18% Dalits in assembly polls’
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav with party state president Jagdanand Singh and other senior leaders at 10 Cir... Read More

PATNA: Continuing with its new strategy to accommodate people from other sections than its traditional base among Muslims and Yadavs, RJD state president Jagdanand Singh said on Saturday that 27% quota for extremely backward caste (EBC) and 18% for the Dalit candidates will be maintained in the distribution of tickets for the upcoming state assembly elections as well.

Addressing mediapersons after a meeting of RJD’s legislators at 10, Circular Road here on Saturday, Jagdanand said, “Our party believes in social justice and expansion of RJD was done on similar lines. All legislators are happy with the reservation given in the election of party district presidents.”

Singh said the RJD legislators have been asked to guide the new district presidents and work in coordination with them for the assembly elections slated to be held later this year.

Leader of opposition in the state assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav asked the legislators to give their best for better results in the upcoming elections. The legislators were also handed over the booth-level data related to party’s performance in previous elections. However, Lalu’s elder son Tej Pratap Yadav was not present in the more than three hours’ long meeting.

Party insiders said discussions were also held on action to be taken against rebel leaders and their anti-party activities. “It was discussed in the meeting that the party high command will soon initiate some action against its MLAs like Prema Choudhary, Maheshwar Yadav and Faraz Fatmi for their anti-party activities,” an RJD legislator said.

RJD has called another meeting of its newly elected district presidents and district principal secretary general on Sunday to announce the names of its state committee members.

Title: Kerala govt promises pay revision before end of term
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: One of the pages which finance minister Thomas Isaac didn ’t read out during his marathon budget speech on Friday contained an important announcement that would have brought more cheers for the ruling front. The paragraph 198 of the budget speech promised government employees that the 11th pay commission recommendations would be implemented in the coming fiscal.

“DA arrears will be disbursed in a phased manner in the next financial year. The practice of government directly paying house building advance for government employees will be brought back,” Isaac said in that paragraph.

The state government in November last year constituted the 11th pay commission, in accordance with the practice of revising the salary and perks of government employees every five years. Though the 10th pay commission headed by Justice C N Ramachandran Nair had recommended that pay revision was required only once in 10 years, the LDF government rejected that proposal.

It is learnt that the plan of the government is to get the report of the 11th commission soon and announce implementation by January 2021 before model code of conduct for assembly polls would be issued. The last-minute announcement, expect LDF leaders, will help the front generously at the time of election.

The 11th commission – led by retired bureaucrat K Mohandas and comprising economist M K Sukumaran Nair and legal expert Ashok Mammen Cherian – has been asked to complete the task by mid-May. With the volume of work that comes under the terms of reference, the deadline is unlikely to realise. The government is also prepared to give a three months’ extension and hopes to conclude post-report consultations before the end of 2020.

Title: Bihar: 15.35 lakh new voters added, but number of third gender falls
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

File photo used for representational purpose

PATNA: Despite last year’s hullabaloo over alleged discrimination in preparation of electors list , the number of third gender voters has reduced in the state, authoritative sources in the office of chief electoral officer (CEO) of Bihar said on Saturday.

According to the updated draft of electoral rolls released by the Election Commission on Friday, there are only 2,344 transgender voters eligible to exercise their franchise in the state assembly election due in October-November this year.

The EC data showed a decrease of 62 third gender votes in the state from 2406 registered before the 2019 Lok Sabha election. On the contrary, altogether 15,35,767 new voters have been included in electoral rolls of 243 assembly constituencies in the state.

According to Reshma Prasad, a transgender and founder of Dostana Safar, there were around 40,000 transgenders in the voting age in Bihar, but only 2406 were enrolled in 2019 as third gender votes as the remaining were either enrolled as male or female.

Prasad, who is a postgraduate from Patna University, said they had voiced their anger over discrimination in electoral rolls last year and authorities had assured them to rectify the errors. “But going by the updated draft, there seems to be no change. Rather the number has decreased,” she said.

Prasad said they would approach the EC. “Gender bias is not a new phenomenon in Bihar,” she said, adding that many from the community were reluctant to get their names included in the voter list. She, however, attributed lack of information and reluctance as main reasons behind decline in the number of registered third gender voters in the state. “But people’s perception about third gender is changing since the Supreme Court’s verdict before the 2014-Lok Sabha polls,” she added.

The updated draft of electoral rolls showed that of the total 7,18,22,450 electors, 3,79,12,127 are males, 3,39,07,979 females and 2,344 third gender voters in the state. Of them, 7,14,988 voters are in the age group of 18-19 years while 13,03,543 are in the age group of above 80 years. Besides, there are 1,58,094 service voters and 72 overseas electors. However, the names of 2,94,969 voters were deleted from the electoral rolls due to duplicity, death or transfer.

CEO (Bihar) H R Srinivasa told the media on the sidelines of release of the updated draft of electors list that the elector population (EP) ratio has increased from 0.495 to 0.504 in the state. Similarly, population gender has increased from 892 to 894, he added.

He attributed the reason for the rise in the number of electors to sustained campaign launched by the EC and special campaign days observed on January 5 and January 12. There are 72,723 polling booths spread over 243 assembly constituencies in the state.

Title: Back from China, youth put in isolation ward
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

PATNA/GAYA: In a bid to prevent the spread of novel coronavirus (nCoV), the state health department and medical experts are keeping tabs on the people returning from China.

A youth from Bodh Gaya , who came back from China in January, was admitted to the isolation ward of the Anugrah Narayan Magadh Medical College and Hospital (ANMMCH) on Friday as a precautionary measure.

Gaya district magistrate Abhishek Singh told this newspaper on Saturday that the youth was kept in the isolation ward, but there was nothing to worry about. “In this case, the incubation period for the CoV is over. Extra precaution is only being exercised to rule out any possibility of its spread,” he claimed.

Gaya civil surgeon Dr B K Singh said, “All tests as per the medical protocol have been conducted and the reports are awaited. Once they are available, action will be taken accordingly.”

Meanwhile, samples of four more people from other parts of the state, which were suspected to be affected by nCoV, were sent to the National Institute of Virology. While two of them — from Saran and West Champaran — were negative, the reports of two others from Supaul and Bhagalpur are still awaited.

According to sources, several teams of health officials, comprising 7,990 doctors and health workers, are screening people in all seven districts along the India-Nepal border and other places across the state.

“Altogether 381 camps have been set up in border areas and 4,119 passengers screened at the Gaya airport so far,” said state surveillance officer Dr Ragini Mishra.

Asked about the precautions being exercised by doctors and paramedical staff engaged in the screening exercise at the Gaya airport, Dr B K Singh pointed out that biological masks had been provided to all the staff engaged in screening work. “They have also been directed to wash their hands regularly and use sanitisers,” he said.

With the growing risk of CoV outbreak, orientation programmes are also being organised in schools. “As many as 509 orientation programmes have been conducted to create awareness about the CoV at different schools in small districts and villages. Regular gram sabha meetings are also being held across the state,” said Mishra.

Title: 400 blocks to get automatic weather stations in 2 years
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

PATNA: The state government has targeted to develop automatic weather stations (AWS) in every panchayat of the state in the next two years.

State planning and development minister Maheshwar Hazari told TOI on Saturday, “The stations, which will come up at a cost of Rs 180 crore, will give a 72-hour forecast and early warning to farmers about extreme weather conditions like floods and droughts through a mobile application. It will also provide information about maximum and minimum temperatures, humidity, wind speed and pressure.”

The minister added, “Our target is to install the AWS in 400 blocks first and later in every panchayat. Bidding process was conducted recently, but no firm qualified. Now, fresh tenders will be floated to invite bids from the interested firms.”

Apart from AWS, the government has also decided to install automatic rain gauge system (ARGS) for measuring and monitoring rainfall in every panchayat.

“Farmers will be connected to the AWS and the ARGS through an app and get timely information about the weather so that they can work accordingly,” Hazari said.

The minister also claimed that work was underway on development of the Bihar Weather Service Centre for issuing forecast and analysis based on the information received from panchayat-level AWS and ARGS.

At present, weather forecast in Bihar is mostly issued by the Patna branch of the India Meteorological Department. Agrometeorological bulletins, on the other hand, are issued by Dr Rajendra Prasad Central Agricultural University (RPCAU) at Pusa in Samastipur.

Assistant professor of agrometeorology in RPCAU, Abdus Sattar, hailed the government’s decision as “it will help develop a good advisory system for the farming community”.

“It is difficult for agricultural scientists and officials to analyse weather parameters across the state and issue agro-advisories accordingly because there are few data retrieving centres in Bihar. The AWS and the ARGS will ensure better planning in agriculture, pest and disease control in crops as well as water management,” Sattar said.

The government has also signed a memorandum of understanding with Skymet, a private weather monitoring agency. When it comes to disaster preparedness, the state water resources department now relies on the data shared by the agency on rainfall forecast and inclement weather alerts.

Title: Power engineers threaten strike on Feb 11 & 12
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

PATNA: Five unions of power companies under the umbrella of Vidyut Kamgar Padhadhikari Abhiyanta Sanyukt Sangharsh Morcha has announced a ‘symbolic’ 24-hour strike on February 11 and 12.

The strike has been called against the rumoured privatization of Bihar State Power Holding Company Limited (BSPHCL) as well as its subsidiary companies.

Power Engineering Service Association’s general secretary Surendra Kumar on Saturday said all the engineers, technical staff, accountants, electricians and other employees of BSPHCL subsidiary companies would join the strike, despite the warning of departmental action under the Essential Service Maintenance Regulation (ESMR), 2020.

Addressing the media here on Saturday, Surendra said the association members would not take the responsibility if the energy department failed to make alternative arrangements for the 24-hour shutdown called by them. “We have already submitted a letter to the BSPHCL CMD-cum-principal secretary of energy department Pratyaya Amrit about the strike. He will be responsible for the inconvenience caused to common people,” he said.

“We have also submitted a charter of demands which include no privatization of power companies in state, removal of CMD and revoking the fake cases against electricity employees who protested on January 27 outside the Vidyut Bhawan among others,” he said.

Upendra Choudhary of Junior Engineering Service Association said they tried to approach the CMD but he was not ready to talk. “We need a written confirmation from the minister and the principal secretary that no privatization will take place, but they are only giving verbal assurances,” he said.

Title: IMFL worth Rs 32L seized, three arrested
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Rajkot: A large cache of Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) worth Rs 32.21 lakh was seized and three bootleggers arrested in Bhachau of Kutch district, Surendranagar and Rajkot on Saturday.

In Bhachau, the officials of Kutch local crime branch seized more 10,000 bottles of IMFL worth Rs 30.45 lakh from a truck and arrested Sukhendrasinh Jat and Rajendra Jat.

In the second operation at a roadside hotel in Ambedkarnagar-1 locality of Surendranagar on Saturday, the officials of Surendranagar local crime branch arrested Bhavesh Solanki (20) and recovered 487 IMFL bottles worth Rs 1.49 lakh from him. However, the co-accused, identified as Shani Parmar and Deepak Vania, fled from the hotel.

Meanwhile in Rajkot, the detection of crime branch (DCB) officials raided Ami Heights Apartment and arrested Dhaval Mundia (30) with 15 IMFL bottles worth Rs 27,820. “We had received a tip-off that Mundia had stored IMFL bottles in his flat, following which we raided his residence and arrested him,” said H M Gadhvi, inspector with the Rajkot DCB.

Title: Cops start taking statements of Tangra accident witnesses
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Kolkata: Four days since the death of Tangra’s Christopher Road resident Gopal Pramanick, 52, the police have begun recording statements of independent witnesses who were on the road that night, including drivers of a few vehicles that crossed the spot within two minutes of the incident.

Most of them, sources claimed, have clarified that they had not seen how or what led to the accident. Most of them reacted after the ambulance hit the victim and fled.

Priyanka Pramanick, 28, though, claimed her father-in-law Gopal was killed when he tried to protest against an attempt to kidnap her. Her family said they might seek the court’s intervention in this matter.

“We spoke to Rabinath Gure, a meat supplier who came forward as a witness. His statement is being videographed. He saw the accident and people running after the ambulance. We ensured his statement is detailed,” said an officer.

A crucial CCTV footage in this case runs for 1 minute and 14 seconds. The accident takes place between 55 and 59 seconds and, by the 60th second, the ambulance is visible with the family members running behind it. “How is it that everything took place in 10-15 seconds? How can someone stop, converse and then pick up speed that can kill a person by dragging him along?” questioned an officer.

Title: Jal Shakti ministry will assist Raj in developing water, crop system
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

EDITED

Jaipur: The Union Jal Shakti ministry will assist Rajasthan in developing its state-specific Integrated Water and Crop Information and Management system (IWCIMS) on pilot basis.

The state-specific system will enable the state to have a repository of satellite images of the ground and surface water bodies, role of artificial intelligence in managing water resources, scientific management of dams and creating buffer zones to meet drought-like situations. It will be done with the help of central agencies like Isro, CAZRI in Jodhpur to name a few.

The state has submitted a proposal to create its own data system which was approved by the Centre on a pilot basis. The success of the state will further open gates for other states to create their own systems. Naveen Mahajan, secretary, water resources and command area development, said, “For a water-scarce state like Rajasthan, it is imperative that water as a resource is scientifically managed and optimally used for agriculture. This integrated approach is the need of the hour and it will go a long way in injecting sustainability in handling water resources.”

This data will help in suggesting farmers the crop pattern and provide them with the irrigation facilities increasing the productivity and income.

The data will be collected under the following modules — reservoir management, water security plan, block-level crop planning, smart grid water transfer, drought management, pollution and water quality and village water budgeting.

“At a macro level, while we will be comprehensively dealing with dam and irrigation mechanism management, what is more important is the grassroot-level relevance of this project. It will be a direct benefit to the villagers to plan their cropping patterns for the coming season based on the scientifically accumulated data like soil moisture and water availability. The data will be available online and will give sustainable impetus to the agrarian economy of the state,” Mahajan said.

It is expected that the system will be developed in two years. It will also include decision support system (DSS), automation of data processing in coherence with satellite imagerie, real-time data acquisition and processing using artificial intelligence (AI).

Title: West Bengal: 62-year-old harassed, cops stop bus, nab accused
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: An engineer from Thakurpukur has taken to Facebook to recount how a section of daily passengers — aged between 50 and 55 who travel in a government bus — harassed his 62-year-old mother last Friday over a seat, reducing her to tears and forcing her to call up her son and seek police intervention midway into her trip.

The cops , however, reacted in time. While the senior citizen kept receiving calls from police, forcing one of the harassers to cut his journey short, a big team stopped the bus at Kidderpore, got the woman and the accused off it and took them to Watgunge police station.

Even though the cops made a general diary, the woman refused to register an FIR. “We have counselled the accused and warned them of severe action if another complaint is made against them,” said an officer.

“Around 10.45am, I got a call from my mother that some men on the bus were harassing her. She was crying and asked me to inform Kolkata Police. I immediately called the Kolkata Police Women ’s Helpline (1091) and an officer heard me out patiently before asking for my mother’s number, name and the approximate location of the bus,” the engineer wrote on Facebook.

“The officer then called my mother and noted down the details. My mother then started receiving calls from Lalbazar, Watgunge police and Hastings police, and within 25 minutes, cops stopped the bus in Kidderpore,” he added.

“I am thankful to the police and am reassured that they keep women’s safety at the top of their list,” he concluded.

Title: 2 cops among 3 held for consuming liquor in Patna
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: An ASI named Lalu Yadav and a constable were among three people arrested while boozing in a khatal (cow shed) near Patliputra police station in the state capital late on Friday night. Lalu, constable Pawan Kumar and khatal owner Nagendra Kumar were sent to jail on Saturday. Breathalyser test confirmed that they had consumed alcohol.

Patliputra police station SHO Kameshwar Prasad Singh said Lalu and Pawan were posted at Shastri Nagar police station in the state capital. Nagendra is stated to be a close relative of one of the two policemen. “Three glasses full of liquor were seized from the spot,” he added.

The cops manning the Patliputra police station were alerted about the boozing by the trio around 11pm. “The khatal has virtually turned into a boozing centre. People frequented the khatal late in the night for that purpose. The local police were in the know of things but they preferred to keep mum for the reason best known to them,” said a retired IAS officer, preferring anonymity.

When contacted, DSP (law & order) Swarn Prabhat said, “The three were arrested for violating the provisions of Bihar Excise and Prohibition Act 2016. They were found drunk late Friday night.”

Lalu, who was working as ‘munshi’ at the Shastri Nagar police station, however, defended himself and told media persons that the cops engaged in the raid were demanding huge money for releasing them from the spot.

DSP Prabhat said he has recommended disciplinary action against the two arrested cops to the SSP.

Title: Clothes show who are against CAA & NRC, says Bihar deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Bihar deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi

PATNA: Referring to the anti-CAA, NRC and NPR campaign launched by former JNUSU president and CPI central committee member Kanhaiya Kumar and other like-minded groups in the state, deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi (SuMo) on Saturday flung the ‘kapda (cloth)’ jibe at the people turning up at the rallies addressed by them.

Earlier, PM Narendra Modi had also made the same kind of ‘cloth’ jibe at those involved in protesting against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), National Register for Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR) in West Bengal .

“These days some Naxal and Leftist people have been holding rallies and meetings in different parts of the state. Who all are turning up at their rallies — you can recognize them by looking at the clothes they wear,” SuMo said, without taking the name of Kanhaiya, who has been on a statewide yatra since January 30 against CAA/NPR/NRC.

SuMo was addressing a function organized by the SC/ST Morcha of the state BJP to celebrate the birth anniversary of Sant Ravidas at the party’s state headquarters. Among others who also addressed the function were the party’s state chief Sanjay Kumar Jaiswal, ministers Nand Kishore Yadav, Prem Kumar and Mangal Pandey.

SuMo also said the same people have been trying to forge Dalit-Muslim alliance in the state on the issues of CAA, NRC and NPR, but it would not succeed, like it did not succeed when the British colonial rulers had tried to do the same in the country. He added that the Dalits have been the part of Hindu society and would continue to remain with it.

Pointing to the need to introduce CAA in the country, SuMo said it has been brought in to give protection to non-Muslim persons by giving them citizenship in India, if they came having suffered religious persecution in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan. He also said Dalits coming from the three countries were the biggest beneficiaries of it.

SuMo also reminded Dalit sections of the ‘Lalu-Rabri rule’ and said Dalits felt most insecure as they faced massacres when they used to be made to fall in line in their villages and would be gunned down. However, the NDA government gave reservation to Dalits in the panchayati raj institutions and also appointed them as Vikas Mitras.

Title: Chirag Paswan to embark on yatra from February 21
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

LJP national president Chirag Paswan with party state president Prince Raj and others talking to journalists a... Read More

PATNA: Lok Janshakti Party (LJP) national president and Jamui MP Chirag Paswan on Saturday said he would embark on the statewide ‘yatra’ from February 21 and address a rally in every district culminating in a state-level rally at Gandhi Maidan on the birth anniversary of B R Ambedkar on April 14.

Stating that the theme of his yatra and political campaign would be “Bihar first, Bihari first,” Chirag said the Nitish Kumar government has done many developmental works and scripted turnaround stories about the state, “but time has come to move beyond them”. He also said a committee would be constituted to prepare the ‘vision document’, which would have inputs from him, the party and other LJP leaders.

Talking to media after the LJP’s state committee meeting here, Chirag refused to make any claim as to the number of assembly seats his party would like to contest in the assembly elections later this year, maintaining that the NDA partners would first reach at a formula for seat sharing.

He, however, said the LJP has been making preparations on the 119 assembly seats at which the NDA partners do not have their sitting MLAs and the panels of the party’s potential candidates would be prepared by the state parliamentary board with respect to them for consideration by the central parliamentary board, so that the party could “zero in on the seats that could go to its kitty.”

At the state committee meeting, the names of the extended committee were also announced, besides taking decisions with regard to gearing up for the poll preparation exercise. State LJP president Prince Raj and the party’s campaign committee chairman cum MLA Raju Tiwari accompanied Chirag.

The standing criteria for the shortlisting and final selection of the potential candidates are two-fold — that they would have to make 25,000 members in each of their constituency concerned and also constitute the booth-level committees.

The state assembly elections are due in October-November this year, but quality difference has come in the NDA in terms of its present coalition partners compared to the 2015 assembly elections. While the Rashtriya Lok Samata Party (RLSP) led by Upendra Kushwaha and Hindustani Awam Morcha (Secular) headed by Jitan Ram Manjhi are out of the NDA, the JD(U) joined it in July 2017. Incidentally, during the parliamentary elections last year, the BJP and JD(U) shared the 40 parliamentary seats, keeping 17 seats each on the 50:50 formula, leaving the six seats for the LJP.

Title: Donald Trump trip: US team, SPG and ATS to work together
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Donald Trump (Photo credit: AP)

AHMEDABAD: A team of United States Secret Service (USSS) and the Special Protection Group (SPG) of the Indian government is likely to visit Ahmedabad on February 11 ahead of US President Donald Trump ’s expected visit to the city between February 23 and February 29. The team will review the security situation before the President’s visit.

A top Gujarat police official said that Trump may visit Gandhi Ashram and is expected to inaugurate Sardar Patel Stadium in Motera, the largest cricket arena in the world.

On January 24, a team of senior bureaucrats of the state had visited the stadium to assess various aspects related to Trump’s visit. This will be the first instance of a serving US president visiting Gujarat.

The new stadium is expected to be ready by second week of February.

Police officials from other districts and the team of National Security Guard (NSG) based in Ahmedabad will be kept on standby, said a senior city police official.

The USSS team, SPG, city crime branch and the anti-terrorism squad will work together to sanitizing areas likely to be visited by Trump.

“Gujarat police is directly in touch with the ministry of home affairs and national security advisor Ajit Doval for security arrangements,” the official added. Sources said that the dates for President Trump’s visit will be finalized only after getting feedback from the USSS team.

Title: 19-year-old kidnaps, molests minor
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

Title: Axe falls on two police officers
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

BIHARSHARIF: Sheikhpura SP Daya Shankar has suspended Ariyari police station house officer Dineshwar Prasad and removed Sheikhpura Sadar police station SHO Chandan Kumar for dereliction of duty following approval from Munger range DIG Manu Maharaaj on Friday evening.

The action was taken a week after the murder of Ariyari block JD (U) president Amit Vashisht alias Nand Kishore Kushwaha during Goddess Saraswati’s idol immersion procession at Sanayya village on February 1. At least 12 other persons from both the warring groups sustained injuries.

On February 2, a large number of angry supporters and sympathizers of the deceased leader had blocked Sheikhpura roads for hours and partially damaged a religious place near Dallu Chowk in the town. They also misbehaved with policemen.

DIG Maharaaj visited Sanayya village and monitored the entire situation. Later, Sheikhpura DM Inayat Khan and SP Daya Shankar led a flag march in the district town on February 2 to instill confidence in the people.

Police, on February 2 night, arrested most of the eight named and five unnamed accused, including the main accused in Kushwaha murder case and lodged FIR against 200 men and 35 women for arson and rioting in Sheikhpura on February 2.

Several JD (U) leaders, including Sheikhpura MLA Randhir Kumar Soni and district president Ashwani Kumar consoled the bereaved family of the deceased leader. Former Sheikhpura MLA Gajanand Shahi too expressed solidarity with the family of the deceased leader on Friday. Several other SHOs and police officers have also been transferred on Friday.

Title: PMC sanitation workers call off strike
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

PATNA: Residents can expect respite from the garbage menace on the city streets as Group-D sanitation workers of Patna Municipal Corporation (PMC) ended their indefinite strike late on Saturday evening.

Urban development and housing department (UDHD) secretary Anand Kishor said garbage will be removed from the city streets within three to four days and the results will be visible from Sunday.

The sanitation workers went on an indefinite strike on Monday in protest against proposed hiring of sanitation workers by the civic bodies through outsourcing agencies after March 31. The move came in the pursuance of a previous order of the Lokayukta.

After six days of their strike, the PMC agreed to their seven-point demands at a meeting held between senior officials of UDHD, the civic body and leaders of the sanitation workers’ union.

The demand agreed upon by the government included continuation of services of all sanitation workers, including permanent workers, daily wagers as well as outsourced ones. Even cases lodged against PMC employees and union leaders during the strike will be taken back.

UDHD minister Suresh Kumar Sharma welcomed the decision and said his department and PMC will continue providing civic services to the people. Patna mayor Sita Sahu also thanked the agitating workers as well as UDHD for resolving the issues.

Mayor Sahu, UDHD secretary Kishor, PMC commissioner Amit Kumar Pandey, ward councillors and union leaders attended the hourlong meeting at PMC headquarters on Maurya Lok Complex. A written agreement was signed between PMC administration and employees’ joint coordination committee.

As per the agreement, 4300 daily wage sanitation workers in PMC will continue to work and their job regularization will be done as per the process having been followed in the past.

It was also decided that a committee will be formed within a week to ensure the implementation of entitlements like minimum wages, EPF, employee’s state insurance and leave related issues as per the labour laws for around 2200 labourers working for PMC though outsourcing agencies.

It was also decided that wages of sanitation workers will not be cut for the strike period and it will be adjusted by taking additional work or service on off days.

PMC staff union president Chandra Prakash said: “We are happy with the decision and calling off our strike. Labourers will resume their work from Saturday night itself.”

Kishor said another meeting will be held with the mayor and union leaders after a week to sort out few other issues.

Title: Lok adalats settle over 3000 pending cases in a day
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Cuttack: The National Lok Adalat on Saturday settled 3169 cases pending in various subordinate courts in the state, registering Rs 40.37 crore towards settlement amounts in the process.

The Odisha State Legal Services Authority (OSLSA), along with the District Legal Services Authority in 30 districts managed to settle 10.20 per cent of the 31,042 cases taken up during the day.

The National Lok Adalat aims to reduce cases pending in courts vis-à-vis providing speedy and inexpensive justice to the people. OSLSA officials said Saturday’s efforts have successfully wiped out 3169 cases pending in subordinate courts in the state.

Besides, 2738 pre-litigation cases were also resolved, officials said. Pre-litigation begins even before the court process starts and attempts to resolve the case before it goes to court.

According to the latest official figures, over 12 lakh cases are pending in various courts across the state. OSLSA officials said total compensation Rs 40.37 crores was awarded on Saturday which related to motor accident claims, bank recovery, water bills, electricity bills and labour disputes among others. Another Rs 10.62 crore was awarded as compensation in pre-litigation cases.

Civil and criminal cases, bank recovery cases, matrimonial disputes, revenue matters, land acquisition matters, consumer cases, labour disputes, motor accident claims and other cases pending in lowers courts and high courts having potential for settlement through arbitration and mutual settlement had been referred to the National Lok Adalat benches across the state.

Six lok adalat benches, formed in the high court with sitting judges, settled 97 of the 833 identified cases. In 87 cases the lok adalat benches in the high court awarded around Rs 4.72 crore while amicably settling insurance claims, an OSLSA official said.

EoM

Title: Two killed after car falls into lake
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Kolkata: A 32-year-old man and a 26-year-old woman — both inebriated — died after their car fell into a lake in Sheuli on Barrackpore-Barasat Road around 11.30pm on Friday. The victims were residents of the Barasat Nilgunj area.

According to cops, Rajibul Islam and Rupa Saha got acquainted on Facebook a month ago and went on an outing on Friday. “Islam was driving at high speed when he lost control of the car. The vehicle then overturned and fell into a lake. Locals alerted cops and tried to rescue the duo, but failed to bring the car out of the water.

“We called the fire brigade and they brought the car out of the lake. But by this time, the duo had died,” an officer said. The victims were taken to Barrackpore BN Bose Hospital where they were declared brought dead. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem.

Title: Couple duped with promise of adoption
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Kolkata: A couple residing at Satchasi Para in Cossipore has been allegedly duped by a gang of cheats who had promised them an infant boy for adoption but had cheated them of Rs 2 lakh.

In the FIR they have lodged, the couple has claimed that they were provided a child who was reportedly physically disabled and hence, they had decided to “return him”. Police said they were investigating the role of the complainants too.

“Apart from the cheating, a physically disabled child’s welfare is at stake here. We are investigating the case keeping these aspects in mind. The probe will be time-consuming,” said an officer.

Title: RTO asks auto dealers to allow vehicle owners to choose insurance companies
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Chamaraja MLA Vasu on Wednesday launched DSK Benelli, the superbike showroom, in the city

Surat: Next time , you purchase two-wheelers or cars and are forced to take vehicle insurance by auto dealers from them, then you can complain to regional transport office (RTO) about the issue.

RTO has instructed all automobile dealers to not force their customers to take vehicle insurance from them. Official sources said state transport commissioner has issued orders to RTOs to take action against such auto dealers.

DK Chavda, regional transport officer, said, “We have issued notices to all automobile dealers across the city and district to not force vehicle owners to take vehicle insurance from them. It will be treated as malpractice. In case of complaint by vehicle owners, there is a legal provision to suspend registration of dealers for three months. We have not received any complaint from vehicle owners against the dealers. We want people to be aware of their rights and choose insurance companies that offer best rates.”

Sources said automobile dealers provide a complete package to their customers purchasing two-wheelers and cars, which includes price of vehicle, vehicle tax, insurance, RTO charges and HSRPs. The customers can’t choose insurance companies on their own.

Raju Shah, vice-chairman of road safety committee, a non-government organization, told TOI, “Automobile dealers earn commission from insurance companies and they also charge extra bucks for HSRPs. Customers normally give in to the demand of the dealers. In the past, we had organized many events in the city to spread awareness among people about these corrupt practices by some dealers.”

Title: DGGI unearths ITC fraud of Rs11 crore by pvt company
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Surat: Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) raided a city-based chemical company and its six beneficiary companies for fraudulently availing of input tax credit (ITC) to the tune of Rs11 crore and evading Rs3 crore worth of GST by issuing fake invoices.

DGGI sleuths raided Universal Dyechem Private Limited, engaged in trading of dyes and chemicals, in the city. Searches were carried out at eight locations in Surat and Navsari districts. Preliminary investigation revealed that the company issued bogus invoices to pass on fake ITC without supply of goods. The company had shown non-existent two-wheelers, three-wheelers and mopeds for transportation of goods.

Further investigation revealed that the other six firms were illicit beneficiaries of fraudulent ITC. Universal Dyechem Private Limited owner Karan Toshniwal was questioned by the DGGI sleuths, officials said. Toshniwal admitted to the fraud of ITC to the tune of Rs11 crore along with the six units.

The DGGI has recovered an amount of Rs3 crore towards GST from the company.

Title: Surat’s secret market of artificial diamonds blooms
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Surat: Defying the Bharat Diamond Bourse’s (BDB) ban on the trading of lab-grown diamonds, Surat has an underground market flourishing in Varachha and Mahidharpura. Here, diamond merchants deal ‘under the table’ in artificial diamonds with their fixed clients from Mumbai and Delhi.

Hub of diamond polishing, Surat’s lab-grown diamond market has more than 500 units manufacturing Rs 5,000 crore worth of diamonds per annum.

“You won’t find these merchants openly dealing in lab-grown diamonds, as they would do with real diamonds in the diamond streets. There are many who are doing brisk business with artificial stones,” said a merchant in Mahidhapura on condition of anonymity.

He further said that he has been trading in real diamonds for the past 17 years. However, looking at the artificials’ lucrative market, he too started dealing in synthetic diamonds for the last few months. He has his buyers based in Mumbai and Delhi. “I procure goods from the local units and sell them to the buyers with good profit margin,” he added.

Decreasing profit from worldwide dip in demand for real diamonds has forced many diamantaires to secretly deal in the lab-grown diamonds. The attraction towards the lab-grown diamond business in India is mainly due to the rising demands in the international markets including the US and the UAE, besides higher profit margin. Though these are almost 50% cheaper to the real diamonds, the export of lab-grown diamonds is increasing from India.

Going by Gems and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC) data, India’s export of lab-grown diamonds has increased by 107% between April and December 2019 at Rs 2,200 crore.

But industry experts rue that there is no governing body in the country, mainly in Mumbai or Surat markets, to check illicit trading of lab-grown diamonds. Diamond merchants carry the illegal business in their own individual capacity, a source said.

Box

What adds to the fake sparkle

Market estimates claim about Rs 50 crore worth of lab-grown diamonds are traded in Surat every month

Profit margins in these deals range between 5 and 6% on the total value of the goods, much higher than real diamonds

Lab-grown diamonds are 50% cheaper than the natural diamonds and used in bling and fashion jewellery

Surat diamond market does not come under Mumbai-based BDB’s purview and so there is no supervision

Also, the diamond markets in Varachha and Mahidhapura are decentralized and unorganized

There is no punishment as such for diamond merchant caught selling artificial diamonds

Quotes

“Both the diamond markets are unorganized and there are no rules as such for the lab-grown diamonds. There are many who deal in lab-grown diamonds with limited customers. We want complete disclosure of the diamonds on the part of the merchants”

Babu Kathiriya, president, Surat Diamond Association

“There is no fear of undisclosed mixing of diamonds, as the majority of the diamond offices have their own synthetic diamond detection equipment. Even if the merchants are dealing in lab-grown diamonds they are doing it with full disclosure”

Manhar Sutaria, member, Mahidhapura diamond brokers association

Title: Four arrested for smuggling firearms, cartridges
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Pistol seized from the accused in Mahuva

Rajkot: Four persons were arrested for allegedly smuggling firearms and cartridges in two separate raids, one in Sayla taluka of Surendranagar and other in Mahuva town of Bhavnagar, on Saturday.

In Chhadiyadi village of Sayla, on the bank of Jaspar dam, Sangram Kalotara (38) was arrested with a muzzle loading gun.

“During interrogation, Kalotara said he had procured the firearm from Dawood Juneja (42) from Jhinjhuvada of Patadi taluka in Surendranagar, following which we nabbed Juneja,” said D M Dhol, inspector with Surendranagar local crime branch (LCB).

On the same day, the LCB officials received a tip-off about one Vinod Garambhadia (27) possessing a firearm. “We caught Garambhadia near lord Hanuman temple on the road between Noli and Devgadh villages. We found a double barrel gun from his possession. A case under Arms Act was registered against him at Dhajala police station,” said Dhol.

Meanwhile in Mahuva, Jenti Gujaria was arrested with a revolver worth Rs 50,000 and six live cartridges worth Rs 600. “During interrogation, Gujaria said he had procured the arms and ammunition from one Babu Bhadarka of Kodia village, following which we have booked Bhadarka and launched a manhunt for him,” said G A Bilakhia, sub-inspector with the D staff of Mahuva police station.

Title: Sweing machine unit gutted in Surat
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Surat: A major fire engulfed a sewing machine manufacturing factory at Lambe Hanuman Road in Varachha where more than 70 old and new sewing machines were gutted in the fire. No casualty was reported.

Officials of the Surat Municipal Corporation’s (SMC) fire and emergency department said that the fire was reported at about 9.20 pm on the ground floor of the one-storey building in Bharat Nagar where the unit was located.

Fire officials said that a person identified as Gopal Bharvad (22), who was working in the electrical showroom located on the first floor of the building was stuck and had gone to the terrace after the fire was reported. He was rescued by the fire officials.

Fire sources said that the fire broke out due to the short circuit in the electric meter box. The owner of the factory, Raju Pansuria rushed out of the factory after the huge spark in the electric meter box.

A fire officer of Kapodara fire station, J A Vala said, “We rescued one person who was stuck on the ground floor. There was no casualty. We were successful in dousing the fire within one hours.”

Title: Ahmedabad: Woman attacked twice by 2 girls in 20 days
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A 26-year-old woman has allegedly been attacked for the second time in 20 days by two girls. The attackers are yet to be identified. The victim, a Vastral resident, lodged a complaint on Friday stating that she is being stalked by the two girls. She said she was attacked on both occasions near Navrangpura Crossroads.

Inspector P B Desai of the Navrangpura police station said that the victim she stated she has no enmity with anyone. “We have gathered CCTV footage and are trying to identify the two girls and the autorickshaw in which they arrived,” Desai said.

According to the FIR, the victim works in a private company in Navrangpura as a team leader. She has mentioned in the FIR that while she was going home at about 6pm 20 days ago, the two girls approached her and pushed her. The girls told the victim to watch where she was going and then scratched her face. The attackers fled when people gathered around them.

According to the FIR, on February 5, when the victim was standing on Navrangpura Road, an autorickshaw approached her. A girl was already seated inside. The victim boarded the autorickshaw. Soon, another girl boarded the autorickshaw.

“According to the victim, one of the girls started pulling her while the other scratched her face,” a police official said. “The victim pleaded with the driver to stop but he threatened her with dire consequences. When the autorickshaw slowed down, the victim jumped out.”

The victim then called her boss and told him about what had happened. “The victim said she was so frightened by the attack that she lodged the FIR only three days later,” the police official said.

Title: Body scanners to find plastic, chemical bombs at Kolkata airport
Content:
A body scanner at an airport.

KOLKATA: Door-frame metal detectors (DFMDs) and hand-held scanners at the Kolkata airport security check will be replaced by full-body scanners. According to Kolkata airport director Kaushik Bhattacharjee, the first 17 scanners will be installed by March.“The body scanners will replace DFMDs and the practice of pat-down searches of passengers to detect objects that are not allowed in a flight cabin,” Bhattacharjee said.The Bureau of Civil Aviation Safety (BCAS), the watchdog agency for ensuring safety and security on flights, decided on full-body scanners to detect non-metallic weapons and explosives that can be concealed on the body since DFMDs and hand-held scanners are unable to detect them. “The nature of threat is changing. To keep pace with it, there is a need for technological upgrade. Body scanners can detect plastic explosives and terrorism tools, including chemical, biological and radiation,” a security consultant said.Addressing privacy concerns over use of scanners that had cropped up in the West, an official said the image generated would be that of a generic mannequin and not a flyer’s actual body contours with threats represented graphically. Apart from addressing security issues, deployment of body scanners is also aimed at accelerating passenger clearance processes since manual frisking takes more time per passenger, an official said.Kolkata airport is on the list classified as hypersensitive. Other airports that will get body scanners include Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Guwahati and Srinagar. Currently, the US has the largest number of body scanners at airports. With the US department for transport demanding body scanners for all passengers travelling to the country, airports in other countries that have flights to the US will have to install them.

Title: ‘Patna to be spick-and-span in 48 hours’
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Patna mayor Sita Sahu

Title: Gujarat: Education department tells schools to organise ‘parents worship’ on February 14
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: In a bid to scuttle students’ attempts to celebrate Valentine 's Day, the district education officer (DEO) in Surat has issued a circular to all schools in the city and district to organise ‘Matru Pitru Poojan Divas’ - Mother Father Worship Day by students on February 14 .

In the covering letter of the circular the education department has stated: “In current times the youth is blindly following those practices which are against the glorious tradition of our country. To nurture best values from childhood and to protect our culture, Mother-Father Worship Day message should be given.”

Apart from instructions to organise the ‘worship day’, the schools have also been asked to send photos of the event in reply to the DEO.

The letter also instructs schools on how to celebrate the day.

The schools will have to call five to 10 parents belonging to different religions and castes. They will also have to invite members of Nagar Prathmik Shikshan Samiti’s members, Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) members, municipal councillors, educationalist or social worker to witness the event.

“In the event, the children should worship their parents in accordance to Indian tradition with tilak, garland, vandan – with folded hands, circumambulating in pradakshina and offering them sweets. A speech should also be delivered about importance of parents in life,” it read.

DEO H H Rajyaguru defended the circular saying that there is nothing wrong in worshipping one’s parents. “The circular only asks schools to follow our tradition. There is no other issue in it,” he said, refusing to elaborate further on why the worship is to be specifically organized on V-Day.

Director of Centre for Social Studies, Kiran Desai told TOI that it is not the role of the education department to get involved in such non-academic activities. “Of course, Valentine’s Day has nothing to do with our culture and I am against any kind of vulgarity or wrongdoings. But at the same time when we have accepted many western things without objections, we should not try to impose religious rituals on students and bring parents in between,” he said.

Title: Coronavirus scare: School tells students to wear masks
Content:
Remote school in Ankleshwar has issued a circular to the parents to send their children wearing mask to school... Read More

BHARUCH/SURAT: With Coronavirus spreading its tentacles across the world, the deadly virus has become a universal fear. So much so that even the authorities of a remote school in Ankleshwar has issued a circular to the parents to send their children wearing mask to school which will safeguard them from any such infectious airborne diseases.Minaxi Bhardwaj, principal of Swami Vivekanand English Medium School said there is no harm in taking precaution. Talking to TOI, she said: “We haven’t made it mandatory, but have advised parents to take precautionary measures to ensure their children are safe wearing masks.”The other crucial purpose for the mask order is to educate students about the deadly virus and also how they can protect themselves from hazards. Children are the future of our country and making them aware of happenings around them will make them ‘informed glocal citizens’, she explained.Bhardwaj added that it is heartening to see most of the students wearing masks, which is a healthy sign.Nimaben Solanki, a parent said that she was happy that the school has taken a novel step to educate children about the seriousness of health issues and importance of hygiene. “Precautionary measures should be taken,” she added.Shorya Modi, a student said that the teachers have taught them how to keep ourselves clean, wash hands several times in a day and cover the mouth with a hanky while coughing or sneezing.

Title: Congress leader alleges RMC lenient with mobile tower owners
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

RAJKOT: Opposition Congress in Rajkot Municipal Corporation (RMC) has alleged that the civic body was acting leniently against owners of mobile towers, who owe it Rs42 crore in property tax dues.

Vashram Sagathiya, leader of opposition in BJP-controlled RMC, alleged that since April 2018 tax dues have been reduced for mobile towers, thus also providing benefit to mobile companies. RMC has launched a special campaign to collect outstanding property tax dues from commercial and industrial property owners, with even sealing many of their premises. He alleged, “RMC was to collect tax dues from 701 mobile tower owners, but over 150 of them have been spared. Interestingly, about 38 towers are not even on the record of the civic body. This has been done with an intention to provide benefit to mobile companies.”

Sagathiya also asked the civic body to aggressively collect tax dues from central government organizations like Indian Railways and India Post.

Title: Gujarat: 19-year-old arrested for sexual harassment of minor girl
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

Title: Surat: Teenager killed over suspicion of affair
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Cops at the spot for investigation

SURAT: Over 100 people arrived at the city police commissionerate with the body of a 17-year-old class XII student who was stabbed to death in an area under the limits of Udhna police station here on Saturday. The victim was stabbed five times by an 18-year-old teenager on Friday over suspicion that he had an affair with his sister. The victim’s family members came to demand quick and strict action against the accused.

Earlier family members and neighbours of deceased Rohit Baviskar sat on a dharna on the campus of New Civil Hospital and refused to accept his body after postmortem. Later they brought the body to the police commissionerate. They were given an assurance of strict action by senior police officials after which they performed Rohit’s last rites.

“The family members were demanding strict action and immediate arrest of the accused. We explained to them complaint has already been registered and that police were working hard to nab the accused,” said a senior police officer.

“We have traced family members of the accused who had also disappeared from their house in Pandesara. But the whereabouts of the teenager are not known yet,” said a police officer at Udhna police station.

Mukesh Pimple, a resident of Nagsen Nagar, has been booked by police for killing Rohit on a complaint by Dashrath, father of the deceased. Pimple suspected Rohit of meeting his sister secretly and had an argument with him in the past, police said.

When Rohit came out of his tuition classes at Vishnu Nagar 1 in Udhna on Friday, the accused stabbed him five times on back side of head, near an ear and twice in chest. The accused had punctured heart of the deceased, police added.

Title: Rajapaksa to offer prayers at KVT, Buddhist shrines in Sarnath today
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Sri Lanka's PM Mahinda Rajapaksa during a media briefing

VARANASI: In his first foreign diplomatic tour after assuming charge as the island nation’s head, Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa will visit Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Varanasi and Buddhist shrines in Sarnath on Sunday.

Rajapaksa arrived in New Delhi on Friday on a five-day visit to India. He met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday. The two leaders discussed various issues including bilateral ties between India and Sri Lanka.

Meanwhile, the district administration was busy with preparations for Rajapaksa’s visit on Saturday. Varanasi district magistrate Kaushal Raj Sharma said, “The Sri Lankan Prime Minster will make only two stops in the city following his arrival on Sunday. He will offer prayers at Kashi Vishwanath Temple and will head to Sarnath late afternoon. After staying the night, he will leave for Bodh Gaya on Monday morning.”

ADG (Varanasi zone) Brij Bhushan and other officials took stock of security arrangements at Kashi Vishwanath Temple and in Sarnath. The culture department also conducted rehearsals for events to be organised along roads during Rajapaksa’s visit.

Apart of the Sri Lankan PM, Varanasi and its neighbouring districts are expected to witness a slew of VIP visits till February-end.

Chief minister Yogi Adityanath will be in Varanasi for two days, starting Monday, to review preparations for PM Narendra Modi’s proposed visit to the city on February 16. President Ram Nath Kovind is also expected to stay in the city for a night after visiting Sonbhadra in February last week.

On his proposed visit, Modi will inaugurate and launch various projects worth Rs 1,210 crore. He will also unveil a statue of Pandit Deen Dayal Upadhyayas at Padao and inaugurate the Lehartara-Chowkaghat flyover.

Sharma said Governor Anandiben Patel will be in the city on a personal visit on Monday. “During his visit, the CM will visit Padao to inspect the statue of Pandit Deen Dayal Upadhyaya, apart from reviewing other preparations,” the district magistrate said.

Yogi is likely to visit Varanasi on the occasion of Mahashivratri on February 21, said Sharma.

Following Modi’s victory in the 2014 Lok Sabha election, his parliamentary constituency Varanasi has welcomed the heads of several nations including Japanese PM Shinzo Abe, French President Emmanuel Macron and German President Frank-Walter Steinmeire to its scenic ghats.

Title: Man freed after paying Rs 3 lakh ransom in Jodhpur
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

JODHPUR: Close on the heels of a person who was abducted and freed after paying Rs 8 lakh here, another person was abducted and let off after an extortion demand of Rs 3 lakh was met. The kidnappers thrashed him badly before dropping him on the road.

The victim filed a complaint of abduction and extortion with the police on Friday night after recovering from the injuries.

According to Pratapnagar police, Aduram Jat stated in his complaint that he was abducted on February 2 by four persons, when he was going in his car near Kailana Lake.

“They stopped at a hotel on Jaisalmer-Jodhpur highway, consumed liquor and beat him. On the way, they demanded Rs 5 lakh as ransom in order to free him. But after expressing his inability to pay the amount, one of them fired a bullet in his leg,” said the complaint.

“The victim, when insisted by the abductors, called up his brother, who expressed his capability to pay Rs 3 lakh only. The abductors then called him at the Riktiya Bheruji circle, collected money from him and pushed Aduram at the circle before fleeing,” said the complaint.

His brother took him to the hospital and after revering from the injuries, Adurma reached the police with his brother on Friday night and filed a complaint against four persons.

“We have begun the investigation into the matter and have been trying to verify the allegations made by the complainant,” said a police official.

It may be noted that before this incident, one person from Mandore areas, Amar Singh Sankhal had also filed a complaint with the police alleging abduction by one Pawan Sankhla, a history-sheeter, and extortion of Rs 8 lakh.

Title: Government won’t interfere in TNPSC scam inquiry: EPS
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Coimbatore: Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on Saturday said his government won’t intervene in the investigation into the TNPSC scam and that they only wanted a fair probe in the case.

Addressing the media at the city airport, he said the Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission (TNPSC) was an independent body and the state police have been investigating the case. “Police have arrested the people who are involved in the scam. The AIADMK government won’t intervene in the inquiry. We want a fair probe to be conducted,” the chief minister said.

He blamed the media for playing up the issue of forest minister Dindigul C Sreenivasan seeking the help of a tribal boy to remove his slippers while he was in the Nilgiris. “He is 70 years old and he was not able to bend and remove a small stick that was stuck in his slipper. So, he sought the tribal boy’s help. He also explained that the boy was like his grandson. Yet, he has sought apology from the boy and his family. The media overplayed the issue and it hurt us severely. AIADMK ministers or any other party functionary won’t involve in such activities at any situation.”

When asked about the cancellation of Class V and Class VIII public exams, the chief minister said they could be cancelled easily. “If we cancel all examinations, how can we evaluate the ability of the children? It will only help the students spend their days within the state as they cannot go out for job. Exams help evaluate the ability of students. Only if we conduct exams, we can ascertain their ability.” He said the exams were cancelled based on the parents’ request.

Pointing out that the public wasn’t aware of the school dropout rate, Palaniswami said the state government had been taking steps to reduce the same.

Regarding the controversial communal remarks that were made by dairy development minister Rajendra Balaji, Palaniswami said he was not aware about the charges leveled against the former. “He is a devotee and he has expressed his own opinion and not that of the party.”

Rajendra Balaji had in a recent interview said some outfits were orchestrating Islamic terrorism. “If they are functioning like that, definitely Hindu terrorism will also be formed and no one could stop that,” he had said. Seizing the opportunity, DMK chief M K Stalin had mounted a scathing attack on the minister, who he said was speaking against secularism. A few days ago, the DMK had petitioned governor Banwarilal Purohit, seeking to remove Rajendra Balaji from the minister post for his hate speech. The opposition party had also petitioned the director general of police against the minister.

Title: Man held for assaulting minor girl
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Coimbatore: A 46-year-old man has been arrested for sexually assaulting a five-year-old girl near Kamarajapuram here on Thursday night.

The city all-woman police (west) identified the accused as K Anand. He is employed with a PVC door manufacturing unit at Kamarajapuram.

According to an investigation officer, the victim’s parents would leave home for work in the morning and return only in the evening. “So, the mother would drop the girl at her younger sister’s house in the same locality. On Thursday night, the girl was unable to sleep and started crying. When the girl’s aunt approached her to know what happened, she told her that Anand had given her chocolate and taken to the manufacturing unit, where he sexually assaulted her,” the officer said.

Immediately, the girl’s mother lodged a complaint with the all-woman police (west), who registered a case against Anand under Sections 5 (m)(l) read with 6 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (Pocso) Act and Sections 376 (A)(B) and 506(i) of the Indian Penal Code. Police arrested him on Friday evening.

On Saturday, Anand was produced before the special court of Pocso cases that remanded him in judicial custody. He was subsequently lodged in the Coimbatore Central Prison.

Title: Financial benefits to being urban area: Michael Lobo
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

SALIGAO: Calangute MLA Michael Lobo said there is a need to grant some villages the status of urban areas, while stressing that there will be no implications from this, as these villages will be eligible for infrastructural benefits. Lobo was speaking at a function at Parra to mark the commencement of works to build footpaths at an estimated cost of Rs 8 lakh.

“Whichever village has been declared as urban, there is a need to upgrade the infrastructure. These villages can avail financial help from the state as well as Centre,” Lobo said. Lobo said there is tremendous growth in some villages as they are getting urbanised and there is a need for a proper sewerage network and electricity.

Lobo added that municipality status can be given to these villages only when the MLA, the panchayat and the people take a resolution in the gram sabha and send it to the government.

Title: Kerala: Rs 70 crore push for six startups
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

The two-day Seeding Kerala summit ended on Saturday

KOCHI: Six startups — Sporthood, Astro-Vision Futuretech Pvt Ltd, Bumberry, ilove9months, Entri and ZappyHire — have received investments totalling Rs 70 crore. This was announced at the second day of the Seeding Kerala investment summit, organized by Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM), which ended here on Saturday.

Bengaluru-based Sporthood, a startup for sports enthusiasts, has got investment from SEA Fund. It was the fourth investment by SEA in Kerala, which has made total of seven investments so far.

Founded by Rahul Antony Thomas, Arun V Nair, Nikhilesh M R and Vikram Devare, Sporthood has a community of 30,000 kids and adults subscribed to the platform. They have a total of 21 established sports clubs across Bengaluru and Kochi.

Astro-Vision Futuretech Pvt Ltd, which provides astrology solutions, has got investment from matrimony.com, one of the largest matrimonial companies in India. It is the first investment by the Chennai-based firm.

Bumberry, a startup that manufactures eco-friendly and reusable cloth diapers, has raised fund from Kerala Angel Network (KAN), led by a group of investors. It is KAN’s maiden investment in a startup. Bumberry was founded by Kutty Krishnan, an educator by profession. Bumberry diapers come as natural bamboo cotton pad and pocket diapers.

US-based Equifin VC will be investing in Maternia Care Technologies Pvt Ltd, which owns the brand ilove9months, a women-led maternity-focused startup. It is also the maiden investment venture in India by the US firm.

Funding of Entri, which facilitates e-learning for job tests and competitive exams was announced by Good Capital last week.

Smart Sparks Angel Network will invest in ZappyHire, which gives companies the flexibility on what tools they would like to use, based on their hiring requirements such as assessment and candidate profiling.

“The first disbursement of fund as per the new schemes announced in the budget for hardware startups will be done in April,” said principal secretary (electronics and IT) M Sivasankar. “I hope banks will also join in this larger bracket in a short period of time. When we put this framework into practice, it would solve the very big challenge of companies,” he added.

Officials of Pavizham Oil and Rice handed over its corporate social responsibility (CSR) fund of Rs 9,40,000 to startup Red Button as part of Red Button public safety programme.

Title: Ahmedabad : 4 dead in blaze at textile unit near Pirana
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

10 persons were reported to be trapped inside

AHMEDABAD: At least four persons were reported dead in a major fire at a textile unit on Narol-Pirana Road on Saturday evening. A total of 19 vehicles from Ahmedabad Fire and Emergency Services (AFES) were pressed into operation as the blaze continued in the unit.

AFES officials said they received a call at 5.48pm reporting a major blaze in the premises of Nandan Denim Ltd on Narol-Pirana Road. “Based on the initial report, initially 12 vehicles were dispatched to the spot. After assessing the severity, seven more were called from nearby fire stations. In all, there were two snorkels, five multi-purpose vehicles and eight tankers among other vehicles,” said a senior AFES official.

Officials said that the ground floor and first floor of the denim production unit were spread across a length of 200 feet. “The discovery of the bodies took time as the unit officials failed to intimate us about potential trapping of workers inside. The interiors suggested that there were only two major exit points, making it difficult for the staff members to make a dash,” said an AFES official. “In total, 10 persons were reported to be trapped inside, the search for others is on.” Nearby residents also rushed to the spot after news of persons trapped in the fire spread in the area. Relatives of the workers also gheraoed the management over the deaths. AFES officials said that the bodies are completely charred and are kept in the same spot. “It’s difficult to ascertain age, gender or any other features. It is likely that the only way they can be identified would be to take the overall stock of the workers in the shift,” said the official. “They would not have got any time to escape.”

A senior executive from Nandan Denim Ltd told TOI that they are yet to ascertain the starting point of the blaze and extent of damage. “The incident primarily affected the shirting division of the premises. We are cooperating with the AFES,” said the official.

“At 10.15pm, most of the area was under control, but there were still embers in several places due to flame from fire in the stock. Thus, it’s likely that some vehicles would be deployed throughout the night,” said an official.

Title: Odisha govt warns colleges against offline admission of students
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

BHUBANESWAR: The higher education department has asked degree colleges in the state not to allow admission of students through offline counselling.

The department shifted to online admission of students from 2011-12 academic session. It has recently found out that some colleges violated admission rules and admitted students through offline counselling.

The department on Wednesday asked three degree colleges to show cause for violating admission rules. The colleges include Raja Madhusudan Dev Degree College of Science and Education in Patia (Bhubaneswar), Krishna Institute of Management and Science (KIMS) in Bhubaneswar and Ghuna Degree College, Ghuna in Balangir.

Jayanta Narayan Sarangi, additional secretary of the higher education department, said the institutions have been asked to respond by February 15.

“The college in Patia has requested the department to regularize admission of 51 students (21 in arts, 14 in commerce and 16 in science) into Plus-III first year, who did not apply through the student academic management system (a single window system for e-admission) in the last admission session,” Sarangi wrote in the showcause notice sent to the college principal.

“This apart, some students have been allotted honours degree by the college without adhering to the cut off marks. It is a gross violation of e-admission rules,” Sarangi added.

Similarly, KIMS has requested the department for regularization of admission of 52 students (33 in arts, seven in commerce and 12 in science) into Plus III first year classes. The number of students admitted to the Balangir college through offline counselling is 21.

While the principals of two colleges could not be contacted, KIMS principal Swarnalata Mishra said they have responded to the department’s notice.

“We have warned all colleges not to admit any student through offline counselling. It will land them into trouble,” a senior official of the department said. The state has 52 government degree colleges and more than 1,000 government aided and private colleges.

Representative image

Title: BMC sets up portal to get rid of construction waste
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

BHUBANESWAR: The Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation ( BMC ) will develop a web portal that will display the progress of construction work and provide detailed information on the waste left behind by various departments.

The idea behind creating the web portal — which will contain the details of construction work under different departments — is to fix responsibility with the department that generates construction and demolition (C&D) waste and leaves them unattended along the road. Anyone can access the website and let the BMC know about the location of the waste and the agency who has undertaken the work. It will help the residents, the BMC and government departments.

BMC officials said people always approached the corporation for removing C&D waste without having any information about the agency that generated it. They added that the BMC always removed the waste (irrespective of the department generating it) to avoid inconveniencing the people.

BMC deputy commissioner (sanitation) Subhendu Sahu said the website would be accessible to all departments that take up construction work under the BMC’s jurisdiction. “It will function like a grievance redress platform. Residents can let the BMC know where the waste is being dumped. The BMC will draw the attention of the department concerned to the complaint on the same portal,” Sahu added. He further said, “In case an agency expresses inability to lift the waste, it will have to pay transportation fee to the BMC, which will act on its behalf. Every communication will be recorded on the portal.”

Though the BMC’s C&D waste management rules came into effect in 2016, they are not strictly enforced. The civic body had earlier launched a drive to seize waste and fine people for dumping it in public places, but it is yet to come up with a strategy if the waste is generated by a government department.

BMC commissioner Prem Chandra Chaudhury said most roads in the city belonged to the works department. “Any waste generated after construction of a road under the works department should be handled by them,” he added.

“There are multiple agencies involved in various works in the city such as digging earth for laying cables. In such a case, the road-owning department should be paid to remove waste by the agency or the department laying cables. The same should be intimated to the BMC for better coordination,” Chaudhury said.

The waste generated through construction, repair, re-modelling and demolition of private and government establishments, households, roads and drains, should be handled carefully to avoid littering. If abandoned, it encroaches on road and makes the city ugly. It also causes accidents.
