Officials said that soon after the tremors, Bageshwar DM Ranjana Rajguru reviewed the situation and instructed emergency response teams to be on alert.

Title: Two-storey building catches fire in Baheri, three hurt
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Bareilly: A two-storey building in Bareilly’s Baheri town was engulfed in flames on Friday night and destroyed. The fire is said to have broken out on the ground floor which houses a confectionery shop, probably due to a short circuit in the electrical equipment kept there.

It took nearly five hours for the fire department to douse the flames. Fire tenders were called in from Bareilly city and neighbouring Uttarakhand because the only tender in Baheri developed some technical snag and its pump stopped working during the operation.

Three persons, including a two-year-old girl, received minor burns due to the fire. The owner of the building lives on the first floor and runs a shop on the ground floor. He claimed that nearly Rs 2 lakh cash, 200 gm of gold jewellery and several household articles were completely destroyed, leading to a loss of nearly Rs 20 lakh.

According to Asif Raza, he was sleeping in his house in Shernaged locality of Baheri town when a strong smell of smoke woke him up. He found that a fire had broken out in the building and it was difficult to exit through the stairs. He along with his wife and two-year-old daughter jumped into the adjacent building. As a result, they all received minor injuries but their condition is stable.

Chief fire officer Chandra Mohan Sharma, said, “The family and local residents realized that a single fire tender alone could not douse the flames which had engulfed the entire building. We had to call more tenders to ensure that the flames were controlled. Fortunately, the fire did not spread to other buildings.”

He added, “The owner of the house was running a confectionary shop on the ground floor. We are yet to assess the total loss and the cause for the fire to break out in the building.”

Title: Three dupe Anand forex trader of US $10K, £5K
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Vadodara: A man from Anand fell prey to three tricksters on the busy RC Dutt Road in the posh Alkapuri area on Saturday afternoon after they hoodwinked him of US $10,000 and £5,000 by posing as customs officers.

The victim identified as Vijay Kalyani got down from an auto rickshaw near a petrol pump beside a prominent hotel and started walking towards Avanti Chambers in the lane beside the petrol pump. One of the three accused approached him and introduced himself as a sales tax officer. “He told the man that his senior officers are calling him,” said a police official, adding that the other accused requested Kalyani to allow them to check his bag.

When he agreed, one accused posing as the senior officer started checking the bag while the other two kept Kalyani busy in conversation. The accused siphoned off the packet containing the cash and returned the bag to Kalyani allowing him to leave the spot. Kalyani resumed his journey towards a money exchange office at Avanti Chambers when he suddenly became suspicious and opened the bag. To his horror, he found that the packet which contained the cash was missing. He quickly turned around to look for the trio, but the trickster trio vanished from the scene on their bikes.

Kalyani then alerted Hitendra Rathod, owner of the currency exchange office and called the police. Cops said that they are examining CCTV footage of traffic junctions and nearby shops to get more details about the accused.

“The complainant wanted to exchange the currency in Vadodara as he too is in the business of forex. We have taken his statement and are also talking to local shop owners or other eyewitnesses,” the police official said.

An offence was registered at Gotri police station late on Saturday night based on Kalyani’s complaint.

Title: New Tirupati SP to give 50% salary for kids’ education
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

After assuming charge as the SP of Tirupati urban police wing on Saturday, Avula Ramesh Reddy promised to contribute 50% of his salary to fund the education of meritorious students.

The 2007 batch IPS officer of the Tripura cadre, who is from Andhra Pradesh, expressed his gratitude towards chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy for providing him with the opportunity to serve his home state after 13 years of service.

As per customary practice, Ramesh Reddy offered prayers to Lord Venkateswara at the Tirumala temple and later reached the district police office where he assumed the charge as the new SP. Speaking to reporters after assuming charge, the new SP outlined his priorities and said ‘‘It is a honour to be an SP of the Tirupati urban police wing whose jurisdiction includes Lord Venkateswara temple at Tirumala. My top priority would be to uphold the peaceful environs of the temple city.”

“Cybercrime is a universal problem and my focus would be to effectively tackle cybercrime by making use of the latest technology. Equal focus would be on bringing down the crime rate against women and children by effectively enforcing the provisions of the new Disha Act,” Ramesh Reddy added.

“I have also taken upon myself certain social obligations, especially given my long-term association with the temple city. From now on, I will ensure to visit at least one school every month and contribute 50% of my salary to fund the educational needs of meritorious students. There are a lot of civil services aspirants here and I would be available to guide the students and help them successfully crack the civil services examinations”, asserted the new Tirupati SP.

Title: ICBC reaches out to private sector for investments
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Pune: The Indo-Canadian Business Chamber (ICBC) has reached out to the business and trade community in the city to showcase fields of potential collaboration and investment for the two countries.

Under the ‘Brand Canada’ initiative of the chambers, Carlos Rojas-Arbulu, consul and head of trade and investment for Consulate General of Canada in Mumbai, said the purpose of the visit to Pune was to strengthen the links with the private sector in the city.

“The fact that there has been such accelerated growth in investments makes me think that the investment environment for companies in India is indeed good. However, there has to be predictability about the rules and they should not change frequently,” Rojas-Arbulu said.

He said Canada was ready to be the near-shore base for companies wishing to serve their clients in the US.

Title: Bomb threat to Noble Hospital in attempt to extort Rs 10 lakh
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Pune: The city police have launched a probe to trace the identity of the person who had sent extortion emails to the Noble Hospital, demanding Rs10 lakh and issuing a threat of a bomb blast.

Suhas Bawache, deputy commissioner of police (zone V), told TOI, “We are conducting a technical investigation to establish the identity of the person responsible for sending the emails.”

Girish Bhosale, the hospital administrator, registered a complaint under sections 387 (putting a person under fear of death or of grievous hurt in order to commit extortion) and 506 (2) [criminal intimidation] of the Indian Penal Code at the Hadapsar police station on Friday night.

Dilip Mane, the medical director of Noble Hospital, said, “Around 5.50pm on Friday, we received an email from an unidentified person, demanding Rs10 lakh. The sender said if his demand was not met with, he would trigger a blast in such a manner that no loss would be caused to patients, but the reputation of the hospital would be tarnished.”

Mane said, “The email stated that patients would stop visiting the hospital to seek treatment. We had received similar emails on January 29 and 31, but did not respond to them. We have shared information with the police and lodged an FIR.”

He said, “One of the emails has a photograph of a clock, indicating a ticking bomb that could go off any moment. We found the contents of the emails to be vague and suspected it could be fake.”

The medical director of the hospital said, “The bomb detection and disposal team later pressed sniffer dogs into service, but nothing suspicious was found on the premises.”

Police are trying to trace the sender of the email and the motive behind the extortion bid.

Title: Devotee dies while trekking on hills
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Coimbatore: A 42-year-old woman died while she was trekking the Marudhamalai hills here on Saturday.

She was headed for Thai Poosam festival and suddenly lost consciousness at the hills.

S Senthamarai, 42 from Uppilipalayam, developed breathing difficulties while climbing the hills on the steps.

Thousands of devotees were trekking the hills to go and worship lord Murugan.

She was rushed to the temporary medical camp which was stalled at government tribal students school. Doctors declared her as dead. Vadavalli police registered a case and sent the body to Coimbatore Medical College Hospital for postmodern.

Title: Number of international students signing up for Savitribai Phule Pune University courses drops
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Savitribai Phule Pune University.

PUNE: From 859 students in 2016-17, the number of international students signing up for courses at Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has decreased to 610 in 2019-20.

While the number of international women students has remained constant at around 200 every year, the male student population has decreased from 621 to 369 over the same period in conventional courses.

SPPU officials attributed the fewer number of students to a difference in the process of counting from 2018, a warlike situation in the Middleeast, stiff competition from the private sector and a trend of students choosing Bengaluru and other such places over Pune.

Vice-chancellor of SPPU Nitin Karmalkar said, “The number corresponds to the conventional courses, not professional courses, where we have foreign students. The admission to technical courses is done through the Directorate of Technical Education and hence, they have the data. The data corresponds with the single-window entry done through the International Centre at SPPU alone. Second, the data of an autonomous colleges has also not been counted since 2018 as they conduct their own admissions.”

Karmalkar also said the scenario is not rosy when it comes to international students and this applies across the country. “The tough visa norms, issues with Foreign Regional Registration Office, issues arising out of applying for a short visa when international students come to take admission before actually coming here for the course on student visa, etc, also cost us students. The conference (Destination India conference organized recently) was held to talk about resolving these issues. There is also a trend among international students of going to Bengaluru and Mysuru. Certain embassies also favour some institutes or destinations for a particular course.”

Mohammad Saif, a student activist working with foreign students, said, “The stipend they get from the government is delayed almost every month. This is a big issue for international students coming to the state universities. If the stipend is not received on time, it affects the students and the varsity’s image.”

Title: Kanpur: Auto-driver’s body recovered
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative Image

KANPUR: Body of a 22-year-old auto-driver, Brijesh Rajput , was found from bushes in Pandu river in Bingawan village.

According to police, the victim’s body bore bullet injury on the right side of his chest. Sources said he might have been murdered somewhere else and his body was dumped in Pandu river. A team of forensic experts along with a dog squad reached the spot and launched an investigation.

Inspector Bidhnoo, Devendra Solanki , said, “Around 9am, a few passersby spotted the body stuck in the bushes in Pandu river and informed us. We found the youth in a pool of blood with bullet injuries.”

The inspector said, “Brijesh is a native of Banpurwa village of Bidhnoo. On Friday evening, he had gone to attend ‘tilak' ceremony of village head Neeraj's brother but thereafter went missing. On Saturday morning, while family his members were conducting searches for him, his friends Anil and Gorey told his brother Ajay that Brijesh got stuck in steel wire and fell in Pandu river".

Title: Hyderabad: MIM, TRS object to hefty penalties for defacing walls and littering
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

File photo used for representational purpose

HYDERABAD: Chaos erupted at GHMC ’s council meeting, on Saturday, over levying of penalties against those defacing walls and littering the city. Claiming that the civic body was unnecessarily harassing poor people and imposing hefty fines, AIMIM legislators and corporators demanded that the practice be stopped immediately. They also, collectively, called for the scrapping of the directorate of enforcement, vigilance and disaster management (GHMC), headed by an IPS officer.

The wing is responsible for enforcement and imposing of fines for civic offences, apart from spearheading rescue operations in times of disaster. Penalty for defacing city facade, range anywhere from Rs 1,000 to a few lakh of rupees.

“Poor are being troubled due to these heavy penalties,” said AIMIM MLC, Syed Amin Ul Hasan Jafri, as his party members took pot shots at the IPS officer — Viswajit Kampati, director, EVDM. “One single institute, was fined more than Rs four lakh ,” added AIMIM corporator from Akberbagh, Syed Minhajuddin

In his defence, Kampati said that the fines are a part of the GHMC act since years. “I did not draft them. EVDM is only implementing the existing act,” he added, even as TRS coporators joined in to oppose the fines. They, however, appreciated the role of disaster response teams. “I oppose the fines but the disaster response team’s work cannot be ignored especially during the rains,” said M Mamatha, TRS corporator from Gunfoundry.

Title: ‘Pertinent issues ignored in assembly’
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

PANAJI: Congress Curtorim MLA Aleixo Reginaldo Lourenco said on Saturday that the recent assembly session was nothing but an eyewash, as pertinent issues relevant to the lives of Goans were not taken up. Lourenco also said that the budget session, which concluded on Friday, was truncated to only a week, which was setting a bad precedent for democracy.

“Since the last monsoon session, I have been trying to bring before the government a private members’ resolution on getting a life-size statue of Jack de Sequeira installed in the assembly complex,” Lourenco said. “But the government seems to be allergic to discussing Goa’s first opposition leader.”

Title: 3-capital plan gets APJAC’s support but with caveats
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy

VIJAYAWADA: AP Joint Action Committee (APJAC), Amaravati, on Saturday passed a resolution in support of the three-capital proposal . The extended state general council meeting of APJAC held at Tummalapalli Kalakshetram, however, listed down 37 demands.

Representatives of around 90 departments and pensioners elected the new general body of the APJAC, which has 40 members. Bopparaju Venkateswarulu was elected as the chairman and APSRTC employees’ union leader YV Rao was elected as the secretary-general.

The JAC chairman urged chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy to fulfil his election promise and remove contributory pension system for government employees. “We are waiting for the decision on reviving the old pension system in the place of the contributory pension system,” Bopparaju Venkateswarulu said.

“We wholeheartedly support the state government’s action plan on decentralisation of administration. We request the government to resolve long- pending issues of the employees before shifting them to other places,” he said. JAC members from various departments demanded that the state government increase the retirement age to 62 years. Ministers Perni Venkata Ramiah (Perni Nani) and Kodali Sri Venkateswara Rao (Kodali Nani) participated in the meet and assured all support from the state government.

Title: Survey to segregate Assamese Muslims from Bangladeshis
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

GUWAHATI: Assam ’s BJP-led government will start conducting a socio-economic census from March this year to identify indigenous Muslims in the state.

Assam minorities development board chairman Muminul Aowal said the objective of the census was to segregate indigenous Muslims from migrants from erstwhile East Bengal , East Pakistan or Bangladesh .

The survey will mainly cover the Goria, Moria, Desi and the tea tribe Jolha communities, whom the government considers indigenous (like other ethnic tribes and communities of the state).

“The names of indigenous Muslims and Bangladeshi Muslims are the same. As a result, the government faces problems in identifying them du ring implementation of various welfare schemes. Since our government is committed towards the welfare of indigenous Muslims, they should have a separate identity,” he told TOI on Saturday.

Aowal said preparations for the census were at their final stages and hoped the exercise will commence “within this financial year”.

A meeting convened on February 11 by the state minorities development department with various stakeholders belonging to indigenous Muslim communities will set the ball rolling for the census, “which will be the first of its kind”, he added.

Title: SRMS convocation held, will become univ
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Bareilly: The 19th convocation of colleges of Shri Ram Murti Smarak (SRMS) Trust took place here on Saturday and degrees were awarded to students of BTech, BPharma, MBA, MCA, MTech and MPharma.

Addressing students on the occasion, SRMS Trust managing director Dev Murti said, “This is an age of digitalization. If you want to become successful in this competitive age, it is necessary to move according to the time as the time passed will never return. If you face hardships in your life, you should think that the God is motivating you to reach your goals. You cannot change the direction of wind but you can adjust the sails to reach your destination.”

Murti added, “The state cabinet on Thursday approved the proposal of SRMS Institutions to upgrade to a university. Students will take admission in SRMS University next year.”

Vinay Kumar Pathak, vice-chancellor, Dr APJAK Technical University, Lucknow, who was the presiding officer at the event, said though 665 colleges are affiliated to APJAK Technical University, SRMS College of Engineering and Technology has occupied first rank in discipline and culture in education in Bareilly.

Title: Police patrol team foils ATM theft
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Nashik: Burglars attempted to steal an automated teller machine ( ATM ) by uprooting it at a village in the Niphad taluka in the early hours of Friday. However, a police patrol team, which was passing by the area, forced the would-be burglars to give up their plan and flee the scene in their car.

Senior police officers the patrolling team even gave a chase to the fleeing suspects till the Nashik Road area. However, the suspects then abandoned their hatchback escape vehicle and fled towards the railway station.

The criminals had sprayed black paint on the CCTV cameras inside the ATM kiosk before attempting to uproot it, said the police.

The police assured that they would soon catch up with the criminals with the help of their car’s registration number. They said the incident took place at an ATM kiosk near the Pimplas Ramache bus stand in Niphad taluka.

Arti Singh, the superintendent of police, Nashik rural, said the gang wanted to uproot the entire machine and take it away at 3 am on Friday. Around the same time, a police patrolling team happened to pass by the area. The burglars, who panicked on the arrival of the police van, jumped into their hatchback and sped towards Nashik. The patrolling team then gave a chase.

The chase continued right till the Nashik Road area. Meanwhile, the Nashik city police too had set up checkpoints after receiving an alert about the fleeing suspects.

Singh said the criminals abandoned their car near the Nashik Road railway station and fled towards the station. She said from the registration number of the car, they would soon identify the owner of the vehicle and track down the criminals.

The police said that two more thefts from ATMs have taken place in the rural district in the recent past. The criminals involved would also be arrested soon.

Title: E-vehicles will help RSRTC to take on trains & pvt cabs
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Jaipur: Rajasthan State Roadways Corporation (RSRTC) is hopeful that the 48 electric buses, which it plans to buy to operate between Jaipur and Delhi, will help the corporation earn healthy revenue. The Volvo buses, which currently operates in this route, are running into losses.

The corporation is currently facing a tough competition from trains like Jaipur-Delhi double decker, private bus operators and the low fare private taxis carrying passengers to Delhi.

This has compelled the administration to decrease the frequency of buses especially during weekdays when passengers’ load is affected.

TOI on Saturday spoke to various officials associated with the planning and operations of the super luxury buses on the Jaipur-Delhi route to know what are the factors affecting the income of the RSRTC buses on the this route.

A senior officer said, “First, many who have to visit Delhi and return on the same day prefer double decker which is a big factor. Second, since the buses to Delhi goes to Kashmiri Gate, it takes extra 90 minutes which becomes unfeasible for passengers. And these days private taxis plying from Narayan Singh circle from Jaipur to Delhi and from Rajiv Chowk (Gurugram) to Jaipur is also taking our passengers away.”

“We have conducted a survey at the Narayan Singh Circle to get an idea on how many private buses are operating to Delhi from this place and their load factor. We will write to the transport department on the number of buses we have noticed to find out if it is equivalent to the number of permits given on this route,” said UD Khan, managing director, RSRTC.

Senior RSRTC officers admitted that during weekdays they get merely five to 10 passengers in Volvo buses to New Delhi. “We get a good passengers load during the weekends but on weekdays it is little problematic,” said an officer.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: 18 IPS officers promoted
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: As many as 18 IPS officers were promoted on Saturday. This include two IG- rank officials to ADG, four DIGs to IG, 11 SP rank officials to DIG rank and one SP rank official was promoted to selection grade.

While Atul Singh and R K Meena from 1995 IPS batch have been promoted as ADGs, Ch Srikanth, A S Khan, J Prabhakar Rao and D Nagendra Kumar from 2002 batch were promoted to IG rank.

The 2006 batch IPS officers Kolli Raghuram Reddy, Ake Ravi Krishna, Sarvashresth Tripathi, R Jayalakshmi, G V G Ashok Kumar, G Vijay Kumar, S Hari Krishna, M Ravi Prakash, S V Rajasekhar Babu, K V Mohan Rao and P H D Ramakrishna have been promoted to DIG rank. B Raja Kumari presently working as Vizianagaram SP has been empanelled and promoted to selection grade. tnn

Title: Pune: Micro-breweries push for growlers amid high demand
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

From one micro-brewery in 2009, the city now has 12.

PUNE: Micro-brewers from the city and state are pushing for introduction of growlers so that patrons can enjoy craft beer in the comfort of their homes in the absence of bottling rights.

Patrons of craft beer have been asking micro-brewers about options to carry beer back home for consumption. The demand for craft beer has been growing steadily in the city over the last three years with more and more people opting for unique flavours and brews as against the regular bottled beer. From one micro-brewery in 2009, the city now has 12 micro-breweries, including some brew pubs and some solely distribution breweries.

Alongside the increasing demand for craft beer at brew pubs and restaurants, demand is also steadily growing for consumption of such beer at home.

“We have regular customers from Pune as well as tourists asking us on social media how they can take our brews back home. As there is no available option at the moment, we are pushing for introduction of growlers. Growlers are parcelled beer pitchers or a beer package that can be taken home for consumption within 48 hours,” said Nakul Bhosale , president of the Maharashtra chapter of Craft Brewers Association of India and founder of Great State Ale Works.

Bhosale stated that the association, which has 17 members in Maharashtra, has been working closely with the state excise department on the issue for nearly a year now.

“Growlers were recently introduced in Bengaluru after due permission from the government. However, they got permission for growlers only at the brewery level. We are looking at refills for growlers at restaurants and pubs. We are also suggesting standalone growler-filling stations,” he stated.

According to Bhosale, Maharashtra is the only state in the country that allows keg-based distribution system. “Due to this, craft brews have made their way to nearly 50 restaurants and bars in the city as against only brew pubs. While Pune was the first city in the country to have a micro-brewery a decade ago, we saw a slowdown soon after. The demand has been steadily increasing only in the last three years,” he explained.

Bhosale added that along with the micro-brewers from Karnataka, an association with two state chapters has been formed to take up various matters with the government. “We have been working with the government for a year on the issue of growlers and fine-tuned a lot of issues. But, with the change in government, we will have to start from scratch,” he added.

Speaking about craft beer, city-based entrepreneur Sakshi Jain said, "From apple cider at Doolallys, wheat beers to pineapple fiction at Toit to Yavasura’s Indiam Pale Ale, we’ve come a long fruitful way from just wheat-based craft beers! I would prefer finely crafted beer over bottled commercial beer any day."

A businessman from Pune, Prasanna Parmar, too, prefers craft beer over bottled beer.

"It’s good to try craft beers instead of bottled beer as they are fresh and there are multiple options to choose from to suit mood and taste," he said.

Title: Truck driver killed in suspected robbery bid
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: Police have recovered the body of a 38-year-old man, who had gone missing on Friday night, from Fatehganj West here on Saturday morning.

The victim Sultan Ali , a resident of Mathurapur village of CB Ganj and a truck driver, had gone missing when he was returning home from work on Friday night. Police suspect that he was murdered by robbers for his new mobile phone and Rs 15,000 he had taken from his employer.

According to his family, Ali had returned to Bareilly on Friday after delivering a consignment in Delhi. He then went to his employer and took Rs 15,000 after which he alerted his family that he was heading home, they added. However, he didn’t return home till late and his phone was also switched off. On Saturday morning, police recovered his body from CB Ganj near the national highway.

CB Ganj station house officer Bachchu Singh said, “The victim has head injuries. Also, the cash and mobile phone that were in his possession are missing. The cause of death will be ascertained only when the postmortem report comes. Ali’s family members claim that he did not have any enmity with anybody. We suspect that he was killed during robbery bid.”

Police have now sought the mobile surveillance report of the area for clues to crack the case.

Title: Minimum temperature rises but chill prevails in the air
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

The IMD expects the minimum temperature in the city to be between 13°C and 15°C over the next few days

Pune: Partly cloudy skies and marginal increase in wind speed ensured chill to prevail in the air even as the city’s minimum temperature rose to 12.1°C on Saturday as against 10.1°C the previous day.

Anupam Kashyapi, head of weather at the India Meteorological Department, Pune, said, “The city witnessed a sudden change in wind pattern at 11.30pm on Friday, with development of some clouding thereafter. This caused the night temperature to rise to 12.1°C in Shivajinagar and 14.2°C in Lohegaon.” Pashan recorded a minimum temperature of 12.1°C.

The IMD said the minimum temperature in the city was expected to stay in the range of 13°C to 15°C over the next couple of days.

Kashyapi attributed the rise in the minimum temperature to clouding due to wind interaction/confluence over vast areas of Odisha, Chhatisgarh, Vidarbha and Telangana. “One branch of wind is coming from the Bay of Bengal carrying moisture. Another branch is passing in northeasterly direction from north Indian states and hence is cooler and contains relatively less moisture. This interaction over a large area has caused clouding with slight rise in minimum temperatures and possibility of trace to very light rains at isolated locations of Vidarbha, Mararthwada and south Madhya Maharashtra till Sunday morning,” Kashyapi said.

Day temperatures also remained on the lower side on Saturday. Shivajinagar recorded a day temperature of 28.6°C on Saturday, 2.6 degrees below normal, while Lohegaon’s day temperature was 28.4°C, 3.6 degrees below normal.

As per IMD forecast, generally cloudy skies to prevail in the city on Sunday, with haze at isolated places in the morning hours. It expects the minimum temperature to stay around 14°C. As for Monday, the Met department expects the minimum temperature to stay around 14°C.

Title: Fix fractured hip instead of total replacement: Study
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

PUNE: Elderly people suffering from hip fractures should opt for partial replacement of the bony structure rather than total replacement as the latter could result in more dislocations after the surgery.

This has been revealed in a multi-centric global study conducted by noted surgeon Mohit Bhandari in association with the Pune-based Sancheti hospital. Bhandari, the professor and academic head of the division of orthopaedic surgery at McMaster University in Canada, stressed on this salient finding of the study during an exclusive interview to TOI when he visited the city last week.

“Our study has found that partial hip replacement is a better option in patients with hip fractures rather than total hip replacement (THR). The study has actually questioned the role of THR in patients with hip fractures,” Bhandari said.

For years, general consensus among surgeons had been in favour of THR, which is also an expensive treatment option.

“This is because it had shown very good results for hip arthritis. THR is one of the best surgeries for hip arthritis with excellent functional outcome,” Bhandari said.

“However, in our study, we found that patients who had undergone total hip replacement developed more complications, such as dislocations, after the surgery. Again, total hip replacement is more invasive, expensive and offers no additional functional benefit,” Bhandari said.

In countries like India where socio-economic factors play an important role in selection of the treatment plan, surgeons should offer treatment providing the best outcomes at the lowest possible cost, experts said.

“Hip fractures rank among the top 10 causes of disability among adults across the globe,” a medical expert said.

“Patients with a hip fracture are at considerable risk for health complications and reduced quality of life. Despite the high frequency of displaced fractures, the way this injury in elderly patients should be surgically managed, however, remains uncertain,” he said.

Cost should not be the only guiding criterion for the treatment plan as many other factors are to be considered while choosing the best option, he added.

In another multi-centric study, the Sancheti hospital played a key role and tested two different types of implants to fix the hip fractures.

“This study suggests that simple cancellous screws show better outcome for simple fractures. However, sliding hip screws might be needed in special cases like smokers or those with displaced fractures of the base femur neck ,” orthopaedic surgeon Parag Sancheti , the Sancheti hospital head, said.

“But again, this is another study that has given surgeons clear guidelines in treating these fractures,” Sancheti added.

Both these studies focused on trauma and that was also the objective of the Pune Trauma Course 2020 held on January 24 where Bhandari guided the surgeons about various modalities of treating hip fractures.

“The focus of this event was to update the surgeons with the latest evidence-based options to treat hip fractures. And both the studies can help the surgeons make informed decision and manage their patients better to ensure their wellbeing in the future,” Sancheti said.

The two studies, called FAITH and HEALTH, took years to be completed and were published in reputed medical journals, giving insights about the best possible treatment option for people suffering from hip fractures, leaving some even bed-ridden.

While FAITH was carried out between 2008 and 2014, HEALTH was carried out between 2009 and 2017.

Title: Pune: Women-only tours for ICC T20 World Cup
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

THE SKIPPER: Harmanpreet Kaur

PUNE: March to Melbourne Cricket Ground to salute the ICC Women’s T20 World Cup finalists this March 8 — the International Women’s Day.

Going by the current form, Harmanpreet Kaur-led Women in Blue have high chance of taking the field on the second Sunday of this March and lift the Cup at the MCG (Melbourne Cricket Ground). Several travel companies in the city have announced woman-only tours to Australia for the ICC Women’s T20 World Cup. So, you can just be there.

The ICC Women’s T20 World Cup will tee off in Sydney on February 21.

As the Down Under is expecting at least five lakh Indians to travel for both the women’s and men’s tournament this year, tour organizers confirmed that they were witnessing a rise in booking from the Indian travellers to visit the women’s sporting event.

“We are seeing a rise in the demand of bookings from Pune to Australia ahead of the ICC Women’s T20 World Cup,” said Daniel D’souza, president and country head, Leisure SOTC Travels.

Nishant Kashikar, country manager, India and Gulf, Tourism Australia, said there was a lot of interest among the travel industry, the ICC official travel agents and hospitality agents for the ICC T20 Women and Men’s T20 World Cup. “Approximately 20 travel agents in the city have launched women-only tours for the ICC Women’s T20 World Cup,” he said.

“We are looking at an increased interest in the women-only tours and it is likely to pick up as the event draws closer,” added Kashikar.

Other firms also expect the bookings to rise as the event draws closer.

Tourism Australia had earlier started a #LedByWomen (or #LBW) campaign to up its ante to promote the ICC T20 Women’s World Cup.

Nikhil Thakurdas, the owner of the Odyssey Tours and Travels, told TOI that the success of the campaign was partially dampened by the recent bushfires in Australia.

“We are telling our prospective clients that the worst of the bushfires is behind us,” said Thakurdas.

In the ICC T20 Women’s World Cup, India are placed in Group A with hosts Australia, New Zealand, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh. The Group B comprises England, South Africa, the West Indies, Pakistan and Thailand.

Kaur-led India squad comprises big-hitter Veda Krishnamurthy, Bengal’s rookie batter Richa Ghosh and 15-year-old Shafali Verma.

Opener Smriti Mandhana has been named Kaur’s deputy for the tournament, which begins with India taking on the hosts in Sydney on February 21.

Title: Consumer court in M’nagar issues notices to online tutoring firm & Shah Rukh Khan
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Muzaffarnagar: A consumer court in Muzaffarnagar has issued notice to a Bangalore-based online tutoring firm and also to its brand ambassador Shah Rukh Khan seeking their responses on a petition alleging breach of trust by the company.

The complainant, Joginder Kumar, had filed the petition in Muzaffarnagar’s consumer forum claiming that he had purchased a tablet and software from the online tutoring firm for his son a few months ago.

“I subscribed to the app-based e-learning software for my son, who is studying in Class 9. It had a clause saying that if the client is not satisfied with the course, the fees will be refunded,” Kumar said in the complaint, adding, “We were not satisfied with the product and filed for a refund. But, the company didn’t respond in spite of several reminders.”

Kumar also made the Bollywood actor a party in the case.

“A seasoned actor like Shah Rukh Khan promoting the App only adds credibility to the product. So the actor is also responsible if the company cheats,” he added.

Kumar’s lawyer, Abhinav Agrawal, said, “Our complaint against the company and actor Khan has been accepted by the court. It has issued notices to them.”

Telling more about the case, Kumar said, “The company representatives had visited my son’s school in October last year and gave a demo of the tab to students.

“Later, they also contacted me and asked to buy this tab with in-build learning software. They also came to my home and convinced us that this tab will help clear all doubts of various subjects and assured us that money will be refunded if we didn’t like the gadget.”

According to Kumar’s lawyer, he paid Rs 40,000 for the product.

Days after purchasing the tab, Kumar contacted the company and complained about the gadget and asked for a refund, he said. "But, the company’s representatives kept on making excuses. They didn’t refund the money,” the lawyer said.

“It was then that we approached the court,” he said.

After issuing notices, the court has fixed March 24 as the next date of hearing.

In November last year, a youth had complained against an ointment firm and its two brand ambassadors. The consumer court had slapped a fine of Rs 20,000 on the firm and two actors who promoted it.

Title: National Lok Adalat settles19,644 cases
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Nashik: The District Legal Service Authority (DLSA) resolved 19,644 cases , most of them criminal, through the National Lok Adalat in various courts across Nashik district on Saturday.

According to the DLSA, 58 benches were constituted under the command of chief district and sessions judge Abhay Waghwase, who is also the president of DLSA, which saw a revenue of Rs 24.93 crore change hands.

The cases included the ones related to recovery of money, electricity bills, land acquisition, Motor Accidents Claims Tribunals (MACT), matrimonial disputes and Negotiable Instruments Act.

The Lok Adalat presents an excellent opportunity for two parties — either two people fighting over some issues or if some government agencies are involved — to arrive at a mean position and exchange the settlement amount to close the case, instead of fighting it out in court.

“Two parties can iron out their differences either at the pre-litigation level or even when the trial is pending and arrive at an amicable solution in front of the members of the judiciary. Thereafter, they lose the right to challenge the settlement,” said DLSA secretary Prasad Kulkarni.

Of the 1.17 lakh cases, 19,644 (16.8%) were resolved. The highest numbers of cases were related to criminal compoundable ones as 746 of the 3,688 were resolved. This was followed by 549 cases out of 10,554 of the MSEDCL that were taken up while 509 out of 3355 cases of the NI Act were resolved.

An amount of Rs 10.07 crore was realised in the settlement of the recovery cases, Rs 6.52 crore in cases related to NI Act, Rs 3.69 crore was settled in the MSEDCL cases, among others.

Title: After Dalits’ conversion threat, officials ask villagers to observe Ravidas Jayanti peacefully
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Bijnor: A day after hundreds of Dalits threatened to convert to Christianity after they were denied permission to re-start Sant Ravidas Jayanti Yatra, senior officials, including district magistrate (DM) Ramakant Pandey and superintendent of police (SP) Sanjeev Tyagi, rushed to Shyamiwala village and asked them to observe the procession peacefully.

Shyamiwala has 30% Hindu population, which houses close to 200 Dalit families.

Notably, the Dalit community has claimed that the procession was stopped during the previous SP government.

Talking to TOI, Pandey said, “We had a meeting with villagers at Shyamiwala on Saturday. We have asked all the villagers to observe Sant Ravidas Jayanti peacefully. If anyone tries to spoil the peace, strict action will be taken against him.”

On being asked about the procession scheduled for February 9, the DM said, “We have taken stock of the situation here, which has been found normal. We are mulling over the issue. It will be decided by late-night whether the procession will be carried out or not in the village. ”

However, a press note released by the police department indicated that the procession may be taken out.

“A meeting was held here at Shyamiwala village to carry out the procession peacefully,” the press note said.

However, apprehensions and speculations over Sant Ravidas Shobha Yatra continued. According to a villager, Sanjeev Kumar, “The DM and the SP came here and held a meeting. They asked us to celebrate the festival peacefully. But, they did not make it clear whether the permission has been given to take out the procession or not.”

It is notable that on Friday also a meeting was held here atcollectorate and dalits of the same village had handed a memorandum to administration and threatened that if procession is not allowed in the village, hundreds of dalit will embrace Christianity.”

Title: Police still questioning two over teen’s death
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Jaipur: The city police are still questioning the two youths who were detained on Friday after a teen died following an assault from his co-worker three days back.

Till now, the police have not found anything against the two detained youths. The main accused was arrested on Friday after the teenager succumbed to injuries on late Thursday night. The 17-year-old Basit Khan worked as a waiter for a catering company in Jaipur and was punched in the head by his co-worker over an argument over opening the door of their vehicle while returning from work on the night of February 4.

Deputy inspector general of police Ashok Gupta said, “We have detained the two youths and are questioning them but till now there is no indication of their involvement in the matter. However, we are also not giving them a clean chit till it is absolutely certain that they were not involved.”

Basit hailed from Kupwara’s Kunan village in Kashmir and is said to be the son of an Army soldier who died a few years back. Following his death, police arrested the co-worker, Aditya Kumar (24) who fatally punched him and detained two others.

According to the complainant, the brawl started over unlocking the door of the vehicle which was supposed to take the catering staff back after an event in Harmada police station area. The accused and the victim got into an argument following which Aditya slapped and punched Basit. The accused punched him several times on his head and when the victim returned home, he complained of severe headache and started vomiting. His friends took him to SMS Hospital where the doctors operated on him but he died due to serious head injury. His uncle arrived from Kupwara and took the body back home on Friday itself.

Title: Two escape from Devgadh Baria prison
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Vadodara: Two inmates of the Devgadh Baria prison in Dahod district escaped on Friday night catching the jail personnel off guard. The duo includes a bootlegger with a series of offences registered against him and a man accused of the rape of a minor.

The incident took place sometime after 7.15pm when the inmates were brought out for prayers in the prison. Two of the inmates Bhikha Rathwa from Mithibor in Chhota Udepur district, and Kaushik Damor from Dumka in Dahod district managed to escape by scaling the walls of the prison. The guards could not spot them at this time.

Rathwa has 21 offences of bootlegging registered against him. Damor was accused of raping a minor girl and an offence was registered against him in January last year.

A senior Dahod district police official said that attempts were being made to locate the duo. He added that the police was informed about the incident only late in the night at around 11pm.

Four other policemen on guard have also been named as accused in the offence registered at the Devgadh Baria police station regarding the incident. These include assistant sub-inspector Ramansinh Ganpatsinh, police constable Alpesh Laxmansinh, Lok Rakshak Dal (LRD) constable Anil Ramesh and LRD constable Ashwin Valsinh.

In June 2011, inmate Parsu Mohaniya had escaped, while, in May 2014, inmates had tried to escape by overpowering the guards of the jail.

Title: AAI-Navy finalise Mopa air space segregation
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

PANAJI: The Airports Authority of India (AAI) and Indian Navy have decided on air space segregation at the upcoming greenfield airport at Mopa . The decision, which has been conveyed to the state government, will have to be approved by the Centre.

Director of civil aviation Suresh Shanbhogue told TOI that it has been agreed that AAI will control the air traffic control (ATC) tower at Mopa. He also said that obtaining defence clearance for the airport would be left to the AAI and Indian Navy.

The state cabinet on Thursday extended the September 2020 deadline that was set for the completion of the airport by 20 months, owing to delays caused by litigation.

A senior government official said that as per the new deadline, the infrastructure at the airport will have to be completed by December 2021 and that operations would begin by May 2022.

He said that it takes at least six months to get permission and clearances to start operations once the infrastructure is in place. The government had signed the concession agreement with GMR Goa for developing the airport on a public-private partnership basis on November 8, 2016.

The three-year construction period of phase I began on September 4, 2017, with the commercial operations date fixed on September 3, 2020. The state government had appointed Engineers India Ltd, a government of India entity, to supervise the project’s progress.

Chief minister Pramod Sawant , in a written reply to the state legislative assembly, said that due to the delay, the cost of phase-1 of the airport is likely to increase beyond the Rs 1,900 crore earlier estimated.

The Supreme Court, which had ordered a status quo on the airport, lifted the ban on January 16, thereby allowing construction to continue.

Title: Panchavati Express to get new LHB coach in five months
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Panchavati Express.

NASHIK: Commuters travelling by the Panchavati Express , who have been raising the pitch for the new Linke Hofmann Busch (LHB) coaches for over one-and-a-half years, have strongly expressed their dissatisfaction with the Cenral Railways for failing to meet their demand and instead installing the updated LHB coaches in Indrayani Express.

From February this year, commuters taking the Indrayani Express to travel between Pune and Mumbai are said to be having a comfortable train journey—thanks to the new LHB coaches.

The LHB coaches have been designed in a way so that there can be an enhancement of accommodation capacity to benefit passengers. Moreover, passengers travelling in these coaches will feel more comfort during the train journey.

Though Panchavati Express (running between Manmad junction in Nashik and Mumbai) was the first to get the LHB coaches on May 1 , 2018, it has still not been equipped with the new coaches.

“The new LHB coaches in Indrayani Express have all the facilities that we have been demanding for Panchavati Express. Yet the Central Railways is not paying heed to our demands,” said Rajesh Fokne, a former member of the Divisional Railway Users Consultative Committee (DRUCC).

Ever since the LHB coaches were introduced for Panchavati Express, regular travellers have been complaining against the bad ergonomics of the coach. Besides making travelling an arduous journey, the less number of windows and their uneven planning add to the discomfort of the commuters. As a result, commuters have developed acute neck and back pain.

Krian Borse, a regular traveller said, “The little space between the chairs aligned in one direction allows passengers little acesss to the aisle.”

The new LHB coaches in Indrayani Express have better ergonomics with seats facing each other, properly aligned windows which enhances the ventilation in the coaches, among a host of other facilities.

“The new coach has 40 windows against the 30 per coach in Panchavati Express. Built by Modern Coach Faction (MCF), Raebareli, the coach can seat 120 passengers, against the capacity of 96 passengers in the old coaches,” said Devraj Malekar, a frequent traveller between Nashik and Mumbai.

Officials in the Central railways said that the new LHB coach would be installed in Panchavati Express in the next four to five months.

Title: Healthcare set for big transformation as Jaipur gets 2 more janta clinics
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Janta clinic at Azad Nagar in city

JAIPUR: The city got two more janta clinics — one at Eidgah Colony and another at Azad Nagar, as health minister Raghu Sharma inaugurated them on Saturday. The state government is aiming at setting up 100 such janta clinics in the state. As of now, 12 more janta clinics are ready for inauguration in Jaipur and three in Jodhpur. These clinics are planned with an aim to bring a transformation in healthcare in the state.

On the lines of Delhi’s Mohalla Clinics, the first Janta Clinic of the state was inaugurated in Valmiki Nagar on December 18 on the completion of one-year of the government.

To add more such clinics in the city, the health minister inaugurated one Janta clinic at Van Vihar of Eidgah Colony and the other was dedicated to the people in slum area of Azad Nagar. Chief minister Ashok Gehlot, in his budget speech 2019-20, had announced such clinics in different parts of the state. But, with the financial year coming to an end soon, the state government has managed to inaugurate only three Janta clinics till Saturday. However, according to the health department sources, two more clinics will be inaugurated in the city — one in Topkhane ka Rasta and the other at Jalupura Park, which will increase the tally to five.

“The important part in Janta Clinics is that it is paperless. The data of patients is kept intact. For the next visit, a patient will have to give his reference number as the data is already available at the clinic. Based on the data, a health card will be issued to the patients,” said Sharma, after inaugurating the clinics.

Health department’s additional chief secretary Rohit Kumar Singh said, “On the first day, the OPD at Van Vihar colony registered 149 patients and 114 were registered at Azad Nagar.”

However, in Jodhpur, three clinics are ready for inauguration. Among the three, one is located at Ayurveda Hospital Bhawan near Mandore railway station, another at Baiji Ka Talab in a municipal corporation census centre and the third one in a school building at Masuriya. The clinics are planned in such as a way that all the three Jodhpur’s assembly constituencies — Sardarpura, Jodhpur city, Soorsagar — get equal share.

Each clinic will have an OPD chamber, medicine counter, patient waiting area and a drug distribution counter. According to the health department officials, more than 300 drugs for free distribution to the patients are made available at Janta Clinics, which has facilities for referral of patients where a medical officer, two nurses, one lady health worker, pharmacist and a grade IV employee will be at the service.

Title: Heritage walk to unveil Alavi Bohra culture
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Participants will have an opportunity to experience the old Mohalla culture which dates back to almost 550 yea... Read More

VADODARA: Heritage Trust, Vadodara and Alavi Bohra community will be jointly organising a heritage walk on Sunday to highlight the Alavi Bohra heritage of the city.

Participants will have an opportunity to have a look at the old Mohalla culture which dates back to almost 550 years.

The heritage walk will begin from Badri Mohalla , Wadi at 5.30 pm. A similar walk highlighting heritage of Alavi Bohra community, a faction of Ismailism, was also organised in the year 2015 during heritage week celebrations.

“Alavi Bohra community have settled in Vadodara almost 550 years ago when the city was just confined within the four gates. The city was not even named Vadodara in those times and the gates were built much later,” said Dr Zulqarnain Bhaisaheb , who is documenting community’s history.

“We have a mosque in our locality – Fakhri masjid at Fakhri mohalla between Mandvi and Gendi gate which dates back to 400 years,” he said.

Sunday’s heritage walk is all about taking a look in and around old city of Vadodara for which 35 participants have already registered.

“The walk will start from community’s main masjid at Badri mohalla after which the participants will be taken for a tour to three old houses which are almost 75 to 90 years old. Also, the participants will see how Bohra topi is made,” he said.

The participants will also have dinner in Bohra style where seven people sit together to have their dinner from a single big dish known as ‘thaal’. “They will dine the Bohra cuisine with both vegetarian and non-vegetarian food items,” he said, adding that the heritage walk this time is more focused on ethnic eating style.

Title: Aspirants mortgaged property to pay for fake academy’s fee of Rs 1.80L
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Agra: Most of the students of the fake maritime academy , ‘Offshore Shipping’, mortgaged their parental property to pay a hefty fee of Rs 1.80 lakh to enroll for a four-month course to train as high sea sailors. Now, left high and dry with certificates not recognized anywhere, they have no idea as to how they can recover their money.

The fake academy had been functioning near NH-2 since 2013. Since then, more than 300 aspiring sailors have enrolled in it. All the “students”, primarily from weaker sections of society, hailed from Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Jharkhand, Haryana, Punjab and Chhattisgarh. A couple of students were from backward eastern districts of UP. Most of them paid the fee in cash. A few paid by cheque, which helped police to build a strong case against the fake academy kingpin, Zulfikar Ahmad, 30, and his aides, Dinesh Kumar, 52, and his son, Lokesh Kumar, 25. Police suspect there are nearly 12 people who are associated with the fake academy and lured the victims to join it by spreading news about it word of mouth and placing fake advertisements .

The modus operandi of the gang was simple. After the declaration of intermediate results by various state education boards, the gang would make calls to gullible students who scored less marks and lived in far off villages, mostly outside UP.

The racket came to light after some duped aspirants contacted police as their certificates were not accepted at any job interview.

An FIR was lodged by one of the victims, Rakesh, 24, from Jalore district of Rajasthan. He said, “They contacted me on phone and offered to get me a job in a foreign-based shipping company if I attended their four-month maritime course. Before joining the academy, I paid Rs 70,000 as initial fee. Since I hail from a poor family, my parents had to mortgage a part of our farmland to raise the money for course fee.”

It was only after he joined the academy that he found he and others had been duped as the claims of having an accreditation from Government of India and an Australian maritime institute were false.

Mayank Tiwari of Lalitpur in eastern Uttar Pradesh said, “My parents paid Rs 1.60 lakh after selling their property so that I could join a shipping course and get a job later.”

According to police, as the gang was charging less fee than any other maritime institutes, many jobless youth joined the fake academy. “We believe in over the past seven years, more than 300-500 students were duped, from whom the gang charged Rs 1.80 lakh as fee,” said Saurabh Dixit, additional superintendent of police.

Mritunjay Verma, owner of Kaushalpura-based complex from which the fake academy was being run, never suspected anything amiss as the rennt was paid on time.

Title: Sandalwood tree stolen from Ramniwas Bagh
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Jaipur: The forest department officials have complained about a sandalwood tree being chopped off and its wood stolen from city’s Ramniwas Bagh. The tree was stolen 10 days back but the case was lodged on Friday. Last year in July, two sandalwood trees were reported stolen from the same place, though the police could not find the accused. In the latest case, the security guard at the Ramniwas Bagh is being questioned.

Mahesh Tiwari (DCF), JDA, said, “Ramniwas Bagh has lots of trees and it was established with the intent so can people gain knowledge about flora and fauna. Sandalwood trees were also planted decades ago and around ten days back one of the oldest one was chopped and the wood stolen. Last year in July, two sandalwood trees had been stolen but no accused were found.”

According to official, sandalwood fetches a price of Rs 10,000 per kg in the market and the three trees stolen are valued in crores. “When I discovered that the tree has been chopped, I realised that it has to be an inside job as someone from outside cannot just come inside and take the tree. Also the person I suspected was living beyond his means. For ten days, we did an internal investigation following which I lodged the case. Now it is up to the police to find the culprit.”

Title: SP, BSP have compromised with RSS: Tauqeer
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

BAREILLY: Appealing to the opposition to launch a massive protest against Citizen Amendment Act (CAA), proposed National Register of Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR), Sunni Barelvi cleric Maulana Tauqeer Raza Khan on Saturday alleged that Samajwadi Party, Bahujan Samaj Party and other small secular outfits have entered into compromise with Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh and these parties feel that whatever government is doing is fine.

“Akhilesh Yadav ( SP leader) is a politician only on twitter and is not active elsewhere. Similar is the condition of Mayawati (BSP chief). The country needs active opposition. If these parties want to contest elections in future, they should stand against the oppression of the ruling party. They should hit the road to stage protests against it, otherwise public will not support them in polls,” said Khan, national president, Ittehad-e-Millat Council (IMC).

Claiming that he will conduct mass protest at every level if the government does not roll back CAA, NRC and NPR, Khan said, “We are not against population survey but we are opposing the implementation of NPR along with NRC. We are against new information which will be sought in NPR.”

Title: 1 dead, many injured after car falls off Pumpwell flyover
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Mangled: People gather near a car which met with an accident on Pumpwell Flyover in Mangaluru on Saturday

Mangaluru: A man was killed and several people were grievously injured, after a speeding car overturned and fell off the newly inaugurated Pumpwell flyover, and fell on a stationery car below, on Saturday evening. The Pumpwell flyover was thrown open to traffic on January 31, 2020, after a decade-long wait.

The victim is Praveen Fernades, 45, a mechanic working at a garage in Gorigudde. Police said that the incident took place around 5pm, when a speeding car coming from Nanthoor and moving towards Thokkottu overturned and fell on another stationary car, parked below the flyover. The victim was inside the parked car.

Victims were rushed to nearby hospitals

Police sources said that locals and motorists present on the busy junction, immediately pulled out the occupants from the mangled cars and rushed them to nearby hospitals.

Praveen, who was rushed to a hospital, succumbed to his injuries there. The condition of the injured are critical, and they are being treated at a private hospital.

Hour-long traffic pile up

The incident threw traffic on the busy Mangaluru-Kasaragod road out-of-gear. There was a traffic pile up for nearly an hour. However, it was cleared with the help of the jurisdictional traffic police station.

Title: Social welfare officer given two years of imprisonment in dowry harassment case
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

AGRA: Firozabad district court awarded two years of imprisonment to social welfare officer in dowry harassment case . Identified as Shyam Sundar, the officer is said to be currently posted in Chittarakoot district.

The court order dates back to January 28 by chief judicial magistrate Kalapraj Singh .

According to the court order copy, Shyam Sundar’s wife Shalini Anand Gautam accused him of dowry harassment and claimed that her father Devanand Gautam gave dowry worth Rs 34 lakh, including Rs 2 lakh in cash, hatchback, fridge, TV, washing machine and a bed among other items. The couple tied the knot on June 5, 2011 and an FIR of dowry harassment was lodged on August 15, 2012.

“Soon after the marriage when Shalini reached her in-law’s home, her husband and the in-laws expressed their displeasure about not receiving Rs 10 lakh cash. She said that her in-laws and husband verbally abused her and physically assaulted her for dowry. They later forced her to vacate the house,” read the court copy.

The court found Shyam Sundar guilty on charges alleged by his wife and was awarded two years of imprisonment, along with Rs 50,000 bond, failing which, the officer would have to serve three more months in jail.

Title: LDF to protest against Union Budget
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: To protest the gross neglect of the state in the Union Budget, the LDF will organize protest marches to central government offices in all assembly constituencies on February 18. A protest gathering will be held after the march in front of one office each in all constituencies. “The protest in 140 locations will be a part of a nationwide campaign announced by Left parties from February 12 to 18,” said LDF convener A Vijayaraghavan.

The campaign has been called by the Left to register its concerns about the budget that will only help weaken the agriculture sector and worsen unemployment. “The budget that focusses on selling off public sector enterprises like LIC has totally neglected the state. Not a single project submitted by the state was included in the budget,” said Vijayaraghavan. tnn

Title: 46,839 cases disposed of at National Lok Adalats
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Jaipur: It was happy ending for litigants as 46,839 disputed cases pending in various courts were disposed of at National Lok Adalats organised across the state on Saturday.

Out of nearly 2.80 lakh listed matters, 46,000 cases were disposed of while an award of nearly Rs 300 crore were released in the adalat. Justice Sangeet Raj Lodha, executive chairman, Rajasthan State Legal Services Authority (RSLSA) inaugurated the National Lok Adalat.

“Forty six thousand eight hundred thirty nine cases were disposed of across the state through various benches and money disputes of nearly Rs 300 crore was settled,” said Ashok Kumar Jain, member secretary, RSLSA.

Title: Schools get 20 days to install CCTVs, tracking system in buses
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

AGRA: Based on the orders of the state government, the regional transport officials have started issuing notices to all schools in the city for the installation of CCTV cameras and vehicle tracking systems in all buses transporting students.

According to transport department officials, schools have been asked to make the necessary arrangements within 20 days. They added that vehicle permits of buses that don’t comply to the directive would be cancelled apart from initiating legal action against the driver concerned.

At present, 1,000 school vehicles are registered with the regional transport office in Agra.

The state transport directorate had recently made CCTVs and VTS mandatory in school buses to ensure safety. The CCTVs would be connected with the VTS to allow real-time monitoring of the speed, location and activities inside the vehicle. An e-challan would be automatically generated in case of speeding.

Regional transport officer AK Singh said, “Notices are being issued to the managements of all schools in the city. They have been asked to install CCTV cameras and VTS in school buses within 20 days failing which the vehicle will be considered unfit. Strict action will be taken against the erring drivers too.”

In the recent years, the human resources ministry had directed the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) to issue revised guidelines making it mandatory for school buses to have GPS, CCTVs and speed governors to ensure safety of children. This was done in the aftermath of the school bus accident near Etah that killed over 10 children and injured scores of others when their vehicle collided with a lorry. The CBSE circular had also said that the school management and the head of the school would be held responsible for any lapse.

Last year, UP State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) had also mooted a proposal to install CCTVs in close to 700 roadways buses plying on three most accident-prone routes of the state. The routes are Lucknow-Delhi via Agra (expressway), Lucknow-Delhi via Bareilly and Lucknow-Gorakhpur via Ayodhya. The move was to get ‘evidence, sequence and reason’ of accidents and discipline drivers. The UPSRTC was also sanctioned Rs 2 crore for the same from the Road Safety Fund.

Title: 13, mob booked in Chhota Udepur Rathwas’ protest
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Tribal protesters blocked highway, burnt tyres to obstruct traffic flow

Vadodara: In separate FIRs filed in Chhota Udepur, 13 individuals along with a mob of around 100 persons were booked for unlawful assembly and blocking roads using trees and burning tyres during the bandh call demonstrations on Friday.

The tribals of the region were protesting in demand for inclusion of Rathwa community in the OBC category.

According to police, the demonstrators had blocked the highway connecting Madhya Pradesh and Vadodara, roads near Tejgadh and Zoz outposts and Sihod Chowkdi in Pavi Jetpur on Friday afternoon. According to police, the protesters had blocked the traffic by felling trees and burning tyres.

At all four locations, the protesters fled seeing police approaching the site but cops could identify 13 protesters. No arrests have been done yet. Although police have booked all for unlawful assembly, no violence were reported in any part of the district.

On Friday, the community had observed a bandh following which shops and business establishments across the district including Chhota Udepur town remained closed. Post offices, banks and even milk dairies downed their shutters as well.

The community has been protesting since 2018 as the revenue records mention members of the community as ‘Koli’ or ‘Koli Rathwa’ which brings them under the Other Backward Classes (OBC) community and the community members want themselves to be recognized as tribal. In the past, both Congress and BJP leaders from the community had shared dais in connection with the same issue.

Title: Youth arrested for raping 5-year-old
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

AGRA: Six days after a youth raped a five-year-old girl, police arrested the accused.

The accused, resident of Tehara village of Saiyan police jurisdiction of Agra district , is a neighbour of the victim.

According to police, on February 3, the accused took the victim to a secluded place near his farm field and raped the victim.

Baijnath Singh, station house officer of Saiyan, said, “The victim was playing with her friends, when the accused took her and raped her. After the incident, the accused fled the spot.”

According to the police, the accused is 19 years old, but his parents claim that he is a minor. The accused was booked under IPC section 376 [2(f)] (commits rape on a woman when she is under twelve years of age) and POCSO act.

Title: Traders organize ‘Jan Sansad’ to protest against AMC
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

AGRA: On Day 26 of their indefinite strike, traders of Sanjay Place market organized “Jan Sansad” (public parliament) to protest against the Agra Municipal Corporation (AMC) decision to levy of parking fee at the market. Playing the role of an MLA and an MP, two traders took over the dais at the dharna spot in the parking space replied to the questions raised by the audience in the negative and against public welfare.

Responding to a question, one of the “public representative to Delhi” said, “Protest are taking place throughout the country, but they hardly make any difference. Your job is to stage protest and our job is to ignore them.”

Since January 14, traders of Sanjay Place have been sitting on an indefinite strike against AMC’s decision to introduce parking fee at 38 places at the market area. The protesters claimed that it violates norms as they had already paid a one-time parking fee at the time of purchasing the property.

Hiren Agarwal, secretary of the market association, said, “We are not going to tolerate AMC administration’s dictatorial decisions at any cost. The parking mafia will not be allowed to operate in Sanjay Place.”

The dispute over parking fees between Sanjay Place traders and AMC is sub-judice. Traders want AMC to cancel parking contracts till the court delivers its verdict in the matter.

Association's treasurer Vinay Mittal said, “We have received the support of over two dozen organizations in our protest against the parking mafia.” Mittal alleged the AMC had allowed people associated with BJP to collect parking fee. “The parking mafia is in collusion with AMC officials. In the past, we have raised the matter with mayor Naveen Jain, but no solution was provided,” he added.

Title: Impose fines for defacing walls: Hyderabad citizens on TOI poll
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

File photo used for representational purpose

HYDERABAD: When elected representatives in GHMC council objected to the civic body’s directorate of enforcement, vigilance and disaster management imposing heavy penalties for defacing city walls and littering in public places, TOI ran a poll on its Twitter handle seeking suggestions from people.

About 90% people lashed out at politicians who opposed penalties. “Of course, there should be heavy penalties. In drunken driving cases, police have taken it up seriously. It has reduced the number of drunken driving cases,” tweeted Ridhima V. “First please create awareness among citizens and then punish offenders. Still many people don’t know that such penalties are being levied and somebody is watching them,” tweeted Alekhya Rao.

“A committee will be formed to deal with penalties,” said Hyderabad mayor Bonthu Rammohan, adding, “TOI ran a poll on Twitter and people are supporting penalties.” - Nabinder Bommala

Title: Tamil Nadu: DVAC books 14 police officers in gadget scam, Rs 300 crore under cloud
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: The Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption ( DVAC ) has slapped a corruption case on 14 officials from the Tamil Nadu police’s telecommunication branch and two private firms based on allegations of irregularities in the purchase of mobiles, CCTV systems, tablet PCs, GPS, CCTV camera and battery for VHF sets from 2016 to 2018.

On Saturday, searches were carried out at 18 places, including the residence and office of the suspected officials and private individuals, an official release from the agency said.

The suspected scam was first brought to light by TOI in September last year after which the then home secretary Niranjan Mardi ordered a DVAC probe into the irregularities. This was after an initial inquiry by the DGP’s office showed prima facie irregularities and misconduct by certain officials, including SP (technical) M Anbuchezhian.

“Some incriminating materials have been seized during the search,” the DVAC said on Saturday. Sources said searches were carried out at the residences of Anbuchezhian and his deputy, additional SP Ramesh. DVAC officially stated that the preliminary inquiry showed that this had caused a huge loss to the government.

The total worth of tenders under scrutiny by DVAC is likely to be around Rs 300 crore , sources said. According to his own Linkedin profile, Anbuchezhian has been in the same post since 2013.

He is part of tender scrutiny committees which decide on the eligibility of companies which bid for police modernisation equipment like digital mobile radio (DMR) systems, APCO, CCTVs and related electronic items.

Documents available with TOI showed that a particular company was favoured in most of the tenders and that there would be only one bidder for the tenders. Documents also showed that Anbuchezhian had overruled concerns raised by senior officials in tender deliberations.

Incidentally, a month after TOI’s report, ADGP (technical services) in the DGP’s office released a press note rubbishing the allegations of corruption and stating that all purchases by the department had been carried out with strict adherence to procedures prescribed under the TN Transparency in Tenders Act.

Title: Recycling at landfill: Mangaluru City Corporation’s new way to fight plastic
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Green move: Workers segregate plastic from the waste dumped at Pachanady

MANGALURU: The Mangaluru City Corporation (MCC) has found a new way to fight growing plastic pollution , by appointing an agency to segregate plastic from the landfill, for recycling.

The MCC appointed Nature Friendly Recycle Industries and Dry Waste Handling to segregate plastic from the waste dumped at Pachanady and recycle it in factories. The project which was started on a pilot basis, yielded good results.

The agency has been segregating an average of 27-28 tonnes of plastic every day. The city, with 60 wards, has been generating an average of 350 tonnes of waste every day. The industry has been segregating the plastic for recycling, and they are also exporting it to foreign countries, said MCC environment engineer Madhu S Manohar.

“They have invested nearly Rs 50 lakh to install all the machinery necessary to process the waste, including pet bottles, plastic carry bags, packing bags, plastic waste, oil packets and other plastic items at our landfill in Pachanady. The move not only reduces MCC’s burden, but also fetches revenue, as the agency is paying the city corporation for the plastic collected from waste. They have been paying Rs 100 for each ton of plastic collected from the landfill. In addition, they are also paying rent for the premises and electricity charges,” Manohar said.

Moreover, he said it is an eco-friendly initiative, and that plastic items will not be thrown into landfills any more. More companies are showing interest in collecting plastic from waste to recycle it, Manohar said.

Workers of the company segregate and collect all plastic items in the first phase, and later it is cleaned using a dust removal machine. A shredder is used to cut plastic waste items into shreds, and it is compressed using a hydraulic automatic pressing machine. Recently, they exported 100 tonnes of crushed bottles to Netherlands, and they have been sending plastic lumps to various recycling companies in India, he added.

Title: 'Pakistan' in Gujarat child's birth papers leaves parents worried
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

AHMEDABAD: Even as concerns and insecurity about proof of one's nationality are rife in the wake of protests raging over the Citizenship Amendment Act and the National Register of Citizens , imagine if your birth certificate has "Pakistan" in your address line!

A family in Vatva area of the city is distressed after the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation issued a birth certificate of their 18-month-old son with residence address mentioning "Pakistan railway crossing" as a landmark.

The crossing in the area is informally referred to as "Pakistan crossing" as it is near a Muslim-dominated locality housing around 2,200 families referred as "Chhota Pakistan". The area is officially called "Vasant Gajendragadkar Nagar EWS Housing" named after the state's first general secretary of the Jan Sangh Party in Gujarat. The infant's family suspects that this reference has inadvertently cropped into official documentation.

Mohammed Uzerkhan, the 18-month-old boy of Arbazkhan Pathan and Mahekbanu Pathan , was born on October 1, 2018. The family lives in Char Maliya Society near Vatva railway crossing. Shaleha Bibi Pathan , grandmother of the child, collected his birth certificate from a civic centre on February 3.

However, when the family read the certificate carefully they were shocked to see "Near Pakistan Railway Station" mentioned as a landmark in their address. Talking to TOI , she said, "After the enactment of CAA and talks of NRC , we are making frantic efforts to get our records in place. We tried to get it rectified at the civic centre but nobody paid any heed to us. So, we rushed to the office of the Danilimda Congress councillor Badruddin Shaikh."

Bhavin Joshi, who is in charge of the office of Registrar of Births and Deaths, said the aggrieved parents have been asked to visit the office on Monday and after verifying their documents, due correction would be made.

Title: Doon property dealer found dead with bullet injury
Content:
This story is from February 9, 2020

Muzaffarnagar: A Dehradun-based property dealer was found dead with a bullet injury in an SUV near Khatauli region of Muzaffarnagar on Saturday morning.The deceased has been identified as Pankaj Sharma. According to police, a country-made firearm and several bullets were also recovered from the vehicle.

According to police, the car has Saharanpur's registration number and was spotted in CCTV installed on Muzaffarnagar- Saharanpur toll plaza last night.
